title: Legal Specialist
description:
**About Us:**

Tromberg, Morris and Partners is a distinguished law firm specializing in providing exceptional legal services in debt collection matters. Our Collection division excels in collecting debt obligations while being sensitive and empathetic to consumers and commercial entities we seek to collect from. With a reputation for excellence and integrity, our firm is committed to achieving optimal outcomes for our clients while fostering positive relationships with consumers and maintaining a high standard of professional ethics.

**Job Description**

Exciting opportunity for a driven candidate that will play a pivotal role in supporting our operations and legal team by managing a diverse array of tasks related to debt collection and legal proceedings. Your responsibilities will include preparing and organizing case files, conducting file level reviews, drafting legal documents such as pleadings, motions, and correspondence, and assisting with the preparation for court hearings and trials. You will also be responsible for tracking case progress, and ensuring compliance with both firm and client guidelines and deadlines. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining professionalism. Prior experience in collections or a related legal field is a must.

**Responsibilities:**

* Calendaring and preparing for court proceedings.
* Maintain litigation electronic databases including uploading key case documents and emails.
* Ability to independently draft pleadings, motions and notices for attorney review.
* Phone que handling for inbound callers assigned to the legal ops que.
* Obtain information required to comply with requests for production of documents.
* Maintain key case deadlines within the firm's system of record.
* Prepare and process legal documents and business communications as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* A degree in Paralegal Studies or Paralegal Certificate required
* 1-2 years of related legal assistant experience in a corporate or law firm environment is preferred.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Demonstrate an ability to successfully manage competing priorities, with experience creating systems to stay organized.
* JST a plus.
* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* Must be driven, ability to multitask and work independently.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Preferred)
* Paralegal: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**About DH2 Chauffeured Transportation:** At DH2 Chauffeured Transportation, we are committed to providing our clients with the highest standards of professionalism and exceptional service. As a MWBE Certified company, we prioritize diversity and inclusion, ensuring our team and partnerships reflect the communities we serve. Our core values—committed, dependable, team player, professional, determined, integrity, and authentic—guide everything we do.

**Position: Customer Service Representative (CSR)**

**Responsibilities:**

* **Client Interaction:** Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, handling incoming calls, emails, and inquiries with a "client-first" focus.
* **Attention to Detail:** Demonstrate unsurpassed attention to detail, anticipating and addressing client needs with proactive solutions.
* **Technology Utilization:** Utilize impactful technology to enhance the client experience and reduce risks associated with travel.
* **Problem Solving:** Troubleshoot daily situations and develop strategic solutions to ensure seamless service delivery.
* **Sales Promotion:** Actively promote and upsell transportation services, leveraging strong sales skills and excellent follow-through.
* **Team Collaboration:** Collaborate with the growing team, adapting to wear multiple hats as the company expands.
* **Geographical Knowledge:** Maintain a deep understanding of the Tri-State area, including airports (JFK, LGA, EWR) and all boroughs.

**Qualifications:**

* **Bilingual:** Fluent in English and Spanish, with excellent oral and written communication skills.
* **Experience:** Minimum 1-2 years of experience in operations, preferably in the transportation industry.
* **Multitasking:** Demonstrated ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage incoming calls effectively.
* **Customer Service:** Proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service and sales performance.
* **Local Knowledge:** Knowledgeable of the local Tri-State area, including airport and borough geography.
* **Hospitality Experience:** Hospitality experience is a valuable asset.
* **Core Values:** Committed, dependable, team player, professional, determined, integrity, and authentic.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* **Paid Training:** Ensure your success in the role with comprehensive training.
* **Competitive Salary:** Starting salary of $18.00 per hour, with the potential for increases based on experience.
* **Weekly Pay:** Enjoy weekly direct deposit pay.
* **Full-Time Schedule:** Monday - Friday from 8 am to 5 pm (1-hour lunch break).
* **Advancement Opportunities:** Opportunities for growth and advancement within the company.

**Join Our Team:** Join our team of dedicated professionals as we continue to delight our clients with every aspect of our service, everywhere in the world. Apply now to be a part of DH2's commitment to excellence and client satisfaction. Submit your resume to stephanie@dh2limo.com or visit our website .

title: Registered Nurse Part Time
description:
Home Instead of Monmouth County is looking for a part time Registered Nurse with availability during the day to become a part of our team and join our mission of enhancing the lives of aging adults throughout our community. Home Instead provides a variety of services that allow seniors to remain in their home and meet the challenges of aging with dignity, care and compassion. You would be working under the supervision of our Director of Nursing.
  
  

**Duties include, but are not limited to:**  

* Assessment and creation of a Plan of Care.
* Performing CHHA(Certified Home Health Aide) Orientation based on the Plan of Care
* Monitoring all CHHA Activity records
* Supervising CHHA's on an ongoing basis.
* Executing a Home safety review, including fall risk assessment
* Emergency Planning
* Periodic patient evaluation and reassessment
* Clinical oversight of Home Instead in-home health care, personal care and companion services program including services rendered by its employees (certified homemaker home health aides and companions).


**Qualified candidates must have the following:**  

Bachelor of Science Degree in Nursing or Home Care Experience with an Associates in Nursing
  
  

Understanding of the Best Practices for Health Care Service Firms per the New Jersey Division of Consumer Affairs and applicable federal, state regulations along with our Franchise and Accredidation Standards.
  
New Jersey Board of Nursing licensed Registered Nurse with education and community health nursing experience with progressive responsibilities in community health nursing.
  
  

Serving all of Monmouth County

title: Loader / Rail Switching Technician
description:
Switching / Loading Technician
  
Sewaren, NJ
  
  

Are you seeking to be a part of a team-oriented company that provides quality training and values safety first? PSC Group is currently seeking a full-time Rail Loader - Switching Technician that will have the opportunity to build a long-term, stable career in an industrial chemical plant. If you're looking for a company that appreciates and recognizes that employees are our #1 asset, then consider joining the PSC family today!
  
  

**Pay Range:** $27.00 - $31.00
  
  

**Work Schedule:** 12 hour rotating shifts (days and nights)
  
  

**Job Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Loader
  
  

* Cleans and visually inspects the railcar before transfer to ensure that it is mechanically sound
* Connects or disconnects loading arm hose for transfer of product
* Inspects for any leaks, weighs railcars and completes required paperwork


Rail Switching
  
  

* Examines track list to plan railcars to be spotted, separated, loaded, and/or built for shipment
* May operate trackmobile or locomotive to safely move railcars in the plant
* Communicates with rail team members, leadership, and customer contacts
* Completes any other duties that may be assigned to complete the job


**Job Qualifications:**  

* Experience is a plus but not required, and paid on-the-job training is available
* May require a valid Driver's License and / or a valid TWIC card, depending on work location
* 18 years or older and legally able to work in the U.S.
* Pass a drug screen, physical, and background check
* Previous military experience and proven ability to follow procedures is a plus.


Why join the PSC team?
  
  

* Since 1952, PSC Group has had a strong reputation for quality service, safety, environmental protection, and taking care of our employees.
* We are a leader in product handling and site logistics for refineries, chemical producers, and marine transportation providers.
* The work we do makes a huge impact in our nation's economy. Check out our videos at PSC Group - Career Videos to learn more.
* Check out our online newsletter "The Connection" which contains articles about our work groups, recognition events, and achievements of our employees and their family members at PSC Group - Newsletter.
* Our Core Values serve as the foundation for all we do—how we conduct our business, serve our customers, and treat members of our PSC family. Learn more at PSC Group - Core Values.


**Employee Benefits:**  

* Medical insurance options with the company paying a large portion of the premiums, including affordable dental and vision plans for employees and their families
* Company-paid life, short-term, and long-term disability insurance
* Matching 401(k) plan to help employees save money for retirement
* Vacation, sick leave, and holiday benefits (varies by work group)
* Incentives, discounts, and bonuses
* Industry-leading training and development programs


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The above job description does not reflect all essential job functions or physical requirements.
  
  

This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company's rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
  
  

PSC Group, formerly known as Petroleum Service Corporation, is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Assistant Branch Manager
description:
**Department:** Loan Operations Department
  
**Reports:** Dual Reporting – Branch Manager and VP/Retail Bank Operations
  
**Schedule:** Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)
  
**Salary:** $55,000 - $57,000
  
  

**Company Overview:**  

**Carver Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:** CARV), the holding company for Carver Federal Savings Bank (the “Bank"), is a federally chartered institution with approximately $744 million in assets and 110 employees. The Bank was chartered in 1948 to address the banking needs of middle income and underserved communities in New York City. Carver operates seven full-service branches in the New York City boroughs of Brooklyn, Queens, and Manhattan. The Bank provides commercial real estate and small business loans and a range of complementary bank products and services.
  
  

**Position Summary:** Supervise and coordinate the operational activities of the branch and work with the Branch Manager to meet branch deposit and account goals. Back-up the Branch Manager in the manager's absence.
  
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

* Coordinate the training of branch personnel and provide on-the-job coaching.
* Conduct periodic audits of cash and cash equivalent items to ensure conformance with established procedures and policies.
* Conduct staff meetings of operations personnel, or confer with subordinate personnel to discuss customer service and sales goals, operational problems or explain procedural changes or practices.
* Assist with sales calls for new business and engage in the sale of a variety of bank products and services, including consumer loans and mortgages.
* Open and close the branch and stay abreast of security policies and procedures.
* Supervise vault operations and procedures and control supply of money on hand to meet branch's daily needs and legal requirements. Verify count of incoming cash shipments.
* Maintain knowledge of branch policies and procedures and insure adherence to audit controls, policies and procedures.
* Process savings and CSR work, when necessary.
* Open the overnight routing bag and examine contents.
* Train personnel in the proper style of communications for both in-person and telephone etiquette.
* Interview applicants and participate in the hiring process.
* Conduct performance reviews, handle employee matters relating to job performance, grievances, promotions, transfers and terminations.
* Document and record events to ensure that all problems are handled with fairness, integrity, honesty, and within legal and regulatory guidelines.
* Ensure compliance with the Community Reinvestment Act, Bank Secrecy Act, Equal Employment Opportunity, and other regulatory issues.
* Handle customer complaints or problems; counsel customers with special problems or situations that require judgment and reasoning skills.
* Compile and distribute required and special reports on operating functions of branch.
* Monitor sales goals.


**Supervisory Duties:**  

* Supervise and coordinate the operational activities of the branch, tellers and customer service representatives.


**Background and Experience:**  

* Ability to make sound judgments with limited information
* At least five years in commercial or savings bank branch operations
* Solid supervisory and customer servicing experience
* Bachelor's degree preferred
* Residents of communities in which Carver branches exist preferred
* Exceptional interpersonal skills
* Excellent written and oral communications skills
* Ability to manage others
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Knowledge of Bank Secrecy and Community Reinvestment Acts
* Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word and bank branch technology

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**About us**

Africa Imports is a wholesale company that offers new and existing business owners the ability to start and grow their business. We have been in business since 1998, and have grown every year, including during the pandemic, since the start of the business. While we are profitable, our values as a company are bigger than just making money. A large portion of our profits go to support orphanages, teachers and other people in need in different parts of Africa. Your work would be making a big difference to many people who create the products that we offer, and to many other people living in difficult situations. See a short video about us here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?time\\_continue=3&v=vEZ1L6evcZE

As a Customer Service Representative, you will have the opportunity to assist customers with their inquiries and provide exceptional service. You will be responsible for handling customer concerns, performing data entry tasks accurately, communicating effectively with customers and all tasks related to providing the best customer service. Fluency in English is required, while multilingual abilities, particularly in Spanish, are highly desirable. Pay starts at $20/hour with raises based on performance.

title: Lab Technician - 2nd Shift
description:
**Requisition ID:** 54007  

**Position Type:** (US)Full Time  

**Workplace Arrangement:**


**About Kerry**
---------------


Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier, tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner, creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.**Where you'll work:**
----------------------



At our Clark, NJ facility, we are part of the Taste division. The Clark manufacturing facilities have 9 work centers with processing capabilities in Liquid Flavor Compounding, Dry Blending, Extractions, Distillations, Spray Dry, Emulsions, Essential Oils, Oleo Resins, Juice Blending. As a team, we are proud to see our products on shelves in-stores. If you’re looking to build a career in manufacturing with a team and facility that values safety and quality, we might be the team for you.

  


**We have an immediate opening for a 2nd shift Lab Technician, the schedule is 2:30pm - 10:30pm Monday through Friday with overtime as needed.**


**What you'll do:**
-------------------



Do you thrive in a fast-paced team environment and work closely with production and other colleagues? The Lab Technician makes quick decisions and uses sound judgement to make rational decisions pertaining to recommended adjustments, corrective actions and disposition of goods.

  


**Dietary restrictions:**


* Candidate must be able to taste meat products / no dietary restrictions.

  




Accuracy Counts! You'll be responsible for conducting required tests, analysis, and/or verification steps to assure that raw materials, batched product, and finished product exceeds established quality standards. The Lab Technician verifies conformity through measurement and assessment.

  


Strong attention to detail is a must. Strict adherence to procedures, policies, and instructions. Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.


 Key Responsibilities:


1. Maintain log(s) of all samples for evaluation.


2. Prepare composite samples.


3. Perform visual and odor screening to become knowledgeable regarding raw materials and products.


4. Verify sample information.


5. Prepare materials and products for laboratory evaluation.


6. Learn sensory, physical, chemical, or instrumental evaluation methods.


7. Retrieve standards and generate worksheets.


8. Maintain clean & safe lab equipment and environment.


9. Utilizes wet chemical, instrumental, physical, and or sensory methods to determine specification parameters of raw materials and finished products.


10. Submit evaluation results to respective areas involved

  


**What you'll need to be successful and safe:**
-----------------------------------------------


* High School Diploma or Equivalent is required;
* College degree in biotechnology, microbiology, food science, or a related field would be preferred.
* Experience with GMP, HACCP, FSMA, FCC/USP/ASTA test methods, aseptic technique and food or pharmaceutical production is desired.
* 2+ years' experience as a lab technician, quality control, or related role.
* Critical thinking and problem solving.
* Must possess basic computer skills; knowledge of word processing and spreadsheet programs required. Knowledge of MS Office and SAP preferred.
* Ability to lift up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds
* Exposure to hazards (machinery, confined spaces, etc.)
* Must be able to work in and around loud noise levels, industrial machinery, air-conditioned environments suitable for carrying out controlled tests

  




The typical hiring range for this role is $24.00 - $27.00 per hour and is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications. This position may also be eligible for a shift differential and/or overtime. In addition to your pay, Kerry offers benefits such as a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and retirement contribution (all benefits and incentives are subject to eligibility requirements).



Kerry is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Kerry will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen. Additional information can be found at: Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal (dol.gov).


Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent us. A Kerry employee will not solicit candidates through a non-Kerry email address or phone number. In addition, Kerry does not currently utilise video chat rooms (e.g., Google Hangouts) to conduct interviews. Refuse any request that asks you to provide payment to participate in the hiring process (e.g., purchasing a “starter kit,” investing in training, or something similar). Kerry will not ask you to pay any money at any point in the hiring process with the exception of reimbursable travel expenses. In addition, any payments made by Kerry will be from official firm accounts bearing the Kerry name.


**Recruiter:**  

**Posting Type:** DNI

title: Director of Staff Development and Training, Residential Services
description:
**POSITION TITLE:** Director of Staff Development and Training, Residential Services

**REPORTS TO:** Administrative Director

**JOB SUMMARY:** The Director of Staff Development and Training, under the direction of the Administrative Director, has responsibility for planning and directing the staff development and training for all employees of the Department of Residential Services. Areas of training and development include orientation events and initial training as well as continuing education/training for all levels of Residential Services staff.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Develops and implements goals for staff development congruent with strategic direction, policies, procedures, and standards of the organization

2. Plans and provides orientation, mandatory in-service, and continuing education in response to regulatory/accreditation requirements and practice needs, and maintains required records and reports.

3. Organizes CPR and safety training, and ensuring availability of training supplies and trainers.

4. Develops needs-assessment tools to determine staff training needs - and develops and implements training to address those needs.

5. Collaborates with department staff, hospital staff, and educational institutions in the interest of educational activities as appropriate.

6. Represents Residential Services in departmental and hospital initiatives involving staff development and training activities.

7. Responsible for utilizing electronic educational materials/equipment (BRAINSHARK) as a learning tool to create training courses for the Residential staff.

8. Reviews and revises course content for Orientation, Competency training, and continuing educational programs.

9. Utilizes appropriate staff members as teachers/leaders in Seminars and in-service programs.

10. Gathers and distributes training resources to staff

11. Produces monthly newsletter for Residential Staff

12. Consults and works closely with Quality Improvement Manager in order to identify and implement staff training to address Quality trends and issues aimed toward improving patient care.

13. Participates on Residential DEI Subcommittee

14. Maintains all staff development/training documentation including attendance sheets.

15. Performs other tasks as assigned by Administrative Director

**EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**

· Master Degree in social welfare, behavioral health, or related field REQUIRED.

**CORE COMPETENCIES:**

· Prepares written and verbal reports that are clear, concise, and timely.

· Manages meetings effectively (prepares agenda, keeps meeting on track, allows for discussion, and keeps minutes

· Creates an environment to promote innovation, creativity, learning, and excellence in education and practice.

· Demonstrates self-direction and effective problem-solving and organizational skills in implementing job responsibilities.

· Maintains records and reports as required

· Takes and active role in developing staff through orientation, precepting and continuing education programs, assuring staff is up to date with credentials and mandatory education requirements.

· Demonstrates respect for others with adherence to hospital policies on attendance and punctuality

· Ensures timely documentation

· Adheres to SJMC and departmental policies and procedures. Additionally, adheres to policies related to Infection Control, Patient Safety, Confidentiality, Patient’s Rights, Advance Directives, Disaster Protocol, Safety and Fire Prevention, Attendance and Punctuality

· Identifies and reduces unsafe practices. This may include reporting unsafe practices, holding accountable the adherence of safe practices, or providing feedback for ideas for safer practices.

· Prevents Hospital Acquired Infections by appropriate hand hygiene. This may include fostering hand hygiene initiatives and holding staff accountable for appropriate hand hygiene.

· Participates in hospital-wide quality initiatives to improve patient safety.

· Demonstrates knowledge of and participates in, the department’s quality improvement initiatives.

· Demonstrates knowledge of incident reporting procedures and seeks supervisory assistance with same knowledge.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS**:

* Three years’ experience in staff development or related area is required.
* Previous residential case management experience working with individuals who have a serious mental illness required
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Must have a valid drivers’ license in good standing.
* Ability to perform in a busy, changing, multi-tasking work environment.

**COMPUTER SKILLS:**

* Proficiency in Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and WORD, databases and retrieval/analysis of data

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $85,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: New Jersey Home Health Aide
description:
**Are you ready for a positive change?®** As a **Seniors Helping Seniors®** caregiver, you can make an amazing difference in multiple lives – including your own!

**Pay: $16-$20/hr + Bonuses and Incentives**

**Shift Details:**

* **PRN/Mornings/Days/Evenings available in Morristown, Basking Ridge, Western Morris County, Somerset, Warren, and Sussex**
* **We work with you to set your schedule!!**

At Seniors Helping Seniors NW NJ, we understand the value of your time and the importance of quality care. That's why we offer a unique 1:1 care model that allows you to focus on one senior at a time, providing quality, concentrated care and companionship. This approach prevents burnout and fosters a deeper connection with our seniors.

title: Manager In Training / Fitness Sales Consultant
description:
**Who Are We?**  
LA Fitness is a privately owned fitness club chain. LA Fitness has hundreds of health clubs and millions of members across US and Canada. In an industry often equated with fad and fashion, LA Fitness has steadily increased its presence by focusing on the one lifelong benefit valued by everyone: good health.

**About Us**  
Founded in Southern California in 1984, LA Fitness continues to seek innovative ways to enhance the physical and emotional well-being of our increasingly diverse membership base. With our wide range of amenities and highly trained staff, we provide fun and effective workout options to family members of all ages and interests.

**Position:**  
Sales Counselor (SC) Do you have a passion for helping people with their health and wellness goals? Can you use those passions to influence others to make positive changes to their lifestyle? We are looking to bring high energy and positive individuals with a background in fitness to join our team as Personal Training Counselors!

We are actively recruiting candidates to take part in our rapidly growing NY Market. In search of Sales representatives with the aspirations to grow into future Fitness Director or General Managers roles due to our explosive growth. Candidates must be Passionate for Fitness, Sales, Marketing, Self-Motivated and Disciplined, Well Organized, and Looking for Career Advancement. Here at LA FITNESS, we are looking for candidates that represent H.E.A.T.; Honest - Enthusiastic - Achievement Oriented - Team Players.

**Job Description**

**The Top 4 Duties of a SC are to act as a:** 

* Personal Performance - meet/exceed company standards with personal commissions and VCLASS production
* Personal Sales Process - show full competency in sales process knowledge. • Personal Customer Service - show ability to always be on time, in uniform, and positively enthusiastic with members, guests, and coworkers.
* Personal Systems - manage your daily planner, guest register, callback list, and success report at company standards. What We Expect from You
* To consistently demonstrate a positive attitude and a strong work ethic we will teach you the skills necessary to build a distinguished career, but you must provide the proper foundation.
* Write good personal commissions consistently
* Achieve company VCLASS standards consistently, VIPs (4) per sale - Calls (60) per day - Leads (20) per day - Appts (6) 1st time per day - Show (3) per day - Sales (3) per day.
* Show competency with rates, commissions, SMT, digital price presentation, F.A. Questions.
* Provide awareness within the local community of what LA Fitness has to offer as well as the ability to create a sense of urgency in becoming a part of our member base.
* Generate personal contacts, business contacts along with daily appointments to tour our facility from your marketing efforts.
* Knowledge within community events ensuring club participation and are actively involved.
* Exceptional external marketing and relationship building through our community outreach program.
* Ability to excel in an environment that sets goals, tracks progress, and strives for growth.
* Ability to effectively communicate expectations to staff and create a winning culture.
* Possess excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
* Must be enthusiastic, energetic, personable, and friendly as well as passionate.
* Previous sales experience required
* To always act with integrity and confidence that what we offer is worth far more than what we ask for it.

**What You Can Expect From Us**

* To be able to advance as high as your performance takes you. The sky is the limit for those who excel.
* To be able to steadily increase your income each month through Downline Bonuses as your client base grows.
* To learn Sales skills, Life skills, Negotiating skills, Time management skills, Leadership skills, People skills and Problem-solving skills.
* An opportunity for an ever-changing career, filled with challenge, opportunity, variety, and satisfaction. Keys to Success / Advancement
* Uphold and support LA Fitness policies positively and enthusiastically.
* Consistently maintain strong personal commissions & VCLASS production.
* Line up personally each day as well or better than your best team member. Demonstrate the daily discipline necessary to consistently excel.
* Train all day, every day. We can all use daily reminders and guidance.
* Take full ownership of your own success.
* Exude confidence, and you'll inspire confidence. Dream big. You will never be better than what you can imagine.
* Have an enthusiastic work ethic. success only comes before work in the dictionary. • Remember, the world is full of talented failures. discipline is what creates superstars.

**Benefits** 

* Commission
* Bonus incentives
* Medical insurance after 90 days
* Growth opportunities
* Complimentary membership
* Full-time position: this position requires 40 hours worked each week.
* Evening and weekend hours are required

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Work Location: In person

title: Vice President (or Assistant Vice President), Planning & Operations
description:
Position Information
Hiring Manager:
Associate Director
Department:
Planning & Operations
Department Overview
The Planning & Operations (“P&O”) Group drives planning, analytics, data management and technology projects while providing operational support for the Investor Partners Group (“IPG”), which has primary responsibility for all of Golub Capital’s business development and client relationship management activities. The team possesses both a deep understanding of IPG’s needs as well as a strong set of unique technical expertise. The Business Operations subgroup manages the operational responsibilities for client-facing teams including reporting, fund close processes, data initiatives and technology projects. Business Operations works very closely with the Global Institutional Sales and Private Wealth Americas Team to provide support for the day-to-day client-service activities.
Position Responsibilities* Leading the creation of operational, data analytics and reporting needs required to support the Private Wealth America’s team and the Firm’s retail product offerings
* Driving cross-functional projects, working closely with key stakeholders and senior leaders across the Investor Partners Group and other business units
* Reviewing third-party service provider reports and managing reconciliation of investor trades with the Transfer Agents’ system while ensuring data is captured accurately in the CRM
* Leading process improvement initiatives
* Managing a portfolio of technology projects
* Building and implementing review steps for key Business Operations deliverables
* Identifying and communicating key project steps, action items and issues to meet deadlines
* Serving as the primary liaison with Transfer Agents, Fund Administrators and digital service providers / platforms (e.g., DST, iCapital, +Subscribe, CAIS)


Candidate Requirements*Qualifications & Experience:** 7+ years of financial industry experience coupled with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical, data analytics, reporting or project management experience, preferably within Investor Servicing in the Alternative Asset Management space
* In-depth understanding of registered and private fund administration, particularly focusing on investor onboarding and platform operations processes of private banks, wirehouses, RIAs and independent broker / dealers
* Strong comprehension of High Net Worth (HNW) investors and Financial Advisor operating models
* Deep knowledge of the investor lifecycle, including onboarding, maintenance and wind-down procedures of alternative investment funds
* Experience working closely with Transfer Agents, Fund Administrators and digital service providers / platforms
* Proven track record in roles at comparable firms, engaged investor servicing and operations activities to support products similar to GCRED’s offering
* Abide by our work-in-office policies then in effect

*Critical Competencies for Success:*
Our Gold Standards Model defines key behaviors and competencies across 4 dimensions: Leadership, Achieving Results, Personal Effectiveness and Thinking Critically. These behaviors and competencies drive our ability to win together.* Leadership: Role models in this area consistently focus on the right goals and priorities and continually develop themselves and others. Always team players, they influence and engage with others to contribute to a supportive and inclusive culture where all feel welcome.
* Achieving Results: Role models in this area are high achievers who develop careful plans and deliver consistently and effectively. They hold themselves and others accountable for delivering high quality results, and they remove barriers to ensure others can contribute and grow.
* Personal Effectiveness: Role models in this area build strong relationships, treat others with respect and communicate effectively. They are driven to exceed expectations and are adaptable to changing circumstances.
* Thinking Critically: Role models in this area understand our business, rely on analytical reasoning and seek diverse perspectives to solve problems. They are forward thinking, anticipating issues and addressing them in advance.


The department-specific competencies define the knowledge, skills and abilities that are needed to successfully perform the functional or technical work of this role.* Firm and Product Knowledge: Demonstrates an understanding of the Firm’s investment strategies, client base, products and investor needs, including the Firm’s structure and competitive advantage in the marketplace.
* Client Focus: Is relentless about understanding internal and external clients’ needs and meeting and exceeding their expectations; drives to have our clients win
* Relationship Management: Creates ways to engage others, cultivate trust and build long-term win-win partnerships with investors, business partners and internal teams.
* Analytical Reasoning: Defines problems and seeks solutions by examining issues and ideas through inquiry, analysis, dialogue, and evaluation; analytical
* Personal Effectiveness: Gets the job done; follows through on commitments and takes actions that are best for the Firm; shows grit and determination
* Initiative: Motivated to achieve goals beyond what is expected; proactive
* Team Work: Initiates and maintains collaborative working relationships; fosters goodwill and cooperation to meet shared goals; team-oriented
* Adaptability: Able to adapt and work effectively in changing circumstances and conditions; flexible
* Innovation: Embodies an agile and creative mindset to help develop new solutions, continuously improve and optimize existing processes and impose structure in ambiguous circumstances through people, process and technology.
* Project Management: Manages projects through planning, identifying resources, executing, monitoring and communicating project activities and assessing impacts of the project decisions.


Critical Competencies for Success
Our Gold Standards Model defines key behaviors and competencies across 4 dimensions: Leadership, Achieving Results, Personal Effectiveness and Thinking Critically. These behaviors and competencies drive our ability to win together.* Leadership: Role models in this area consistently focus on the right goals and priorities and continually develop themselves and others. Always team players, they influence and engage with others to contribute to a supportive and inclusive culture where all feel welcome.
* Achieving Results: Role models in this area are high achievers who develop careful plans and deliver consistently and effectively. They hold themselves and others accountable for delivering high quality results, and they remove barriers to ensure others can contribute and grow.
* Thinking Critically: Role models in this area understand our business, rely on analytical reasoning and seek diverse perspectives to solve problems. They are forward thinking, anticipating issues and addressing them in advance.
* Personal Effectiveness: Role models in this area build strong relationships, treat others with respect and communicate effectively. They are driven to exceed expectations and are adaptable to changing circumstances.


The department-specific competencies define the knowledge, skills and abilities that are needed to successfully perform the functional or technical work of this role.* Industry Knowledge: Demonstrates an understanding of the Firm’s position in the industry, specifically with regard to direct lending and asset management, as well as the competitive landscape. Monitors industry trends and changes and recognizes their relevancy and implications to the Firm.
* Firm and Product Knowledge: Demonstrates an understanding of the Firm’s investment strategies, client base, products and investor needs, including the Firm’s structure and competitive advantage in the marketplace.
* Innovation: Embodies an agile and creative mindset to help develop new solutions, continuously improve and optimize existing processes and impose structure in ambiguous circumstances through people, process and technology.
* Project / Program Management: Manages projects and / or programs through planning, identifying resources, executing, monitoring and communicating project activities and assessing impacts of the project decisions.
* Analytics: Surfaces, sources, analyzes and interprets data to identify trends and inform strategy and business decisions.
* Data and Content Stewardship: Follows appropriate policies and procedures to enter and manage data and content, including evaluating issues with data and content and taking appropriate steps to address them. Communicates with others regarding data and content stewardship to ensure accuracy and integrity and encourages others to uphold data and content stewardship practices.
* Relationship Management: Creates ways to engage others, cultivate trust and build long-term win-win partnerships with investors, business partners and internal teams.


Compensation and Benefits
For New York Only: It is expected that the base salary range for this position will be $175,000 to $225,000 for a Vice President and $150,000 to $170,000 for an Assistant Vice President. Actual salaries may vary based on factors such as skills, experiences and qualifications for the role. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements and discretionary awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial and / or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits such as vacation, sick time and parental leave) dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, the employee will be in an ‘at-will position’ and the Firm reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time including for reasons related to individual performance, Firm or individual department / team performance and market factors.
Golub Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Reg. Dietician Nutritionist
description:
**Bronx Community Health Network**

**Job Title:** Reg. Dietician/Nutritionist

**Schedule:** Monday – Friday 9:00am – 5:30pm

**Supervisor:** Chief Medical Officer

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Job Type:** Full-Time 37.5 hours weekly

**FLSA:** Exempt

**Salary:** $70,000 - $85,000

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. BCHN service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

**BCHN mission:** To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

BCHN is seeking to hire a Dietician/Nutritionist to establish short and long-term health goals with patients, teaching the patients and the community about health and nutrition and developing effective nutritional exercise plans for patients or individuals in the community.

**About the Role:** The Dietician/Nutritionist is responsible forproviding nutritional services to patients, which includes counseling, nutritional assessments, prescriptions, and evaluation of nutritional-related lab parameters, as part of a member of the team to improve results and maximize outcomes.

Ø Provides quality, comprehensive care for patients with chronic condition or the risk of chronic conditions, through individual consultations and group classes.

Ø Assess patient’s needs (nutritional, psychosocial, environmental, self-care, educational needs, and home needs). Adjust intensity of service based on needs, and appropriate utilization of resources.

Ø Develop patient centered plan of care based on individualized patient needs.

Ø Utilize motivational interviewing, goal setting strategies and SMART goal development to promote realistic and successful behavior change.

Ø Uses self-management-training techniques, assess, plan, and implement patient and family education in an individual and/or group setting. Education includes but is not limited to healthy eating, physical activity, self-monitoring, taking medications, and coping skills.

Ø Evaluate the effectiveness of educational process toward achieving self-management. Refer when appropriate.

Ø Identifies available community resources helpful to patients, refers and assists patients in utilizing such resources.

Ø Provides telehealth services to patients as appropriate.

Ø Completes documentation of patient status, plan of care, and progress.

Ø Demonstrates ability to interpret and maintain patient and site data.

Ø Participates in quality improvement activities, attending department meetings, etc.

Ø Collaborates with all care team members in planning and delivering appropriate patient care.

Ø Speak to groups about the importance of nutrition to prevent specific diseases.

Ø Create educational material about healthy eating habits.

Ø Responsible for staying updated on regular health trends and diets to ensure they’re providing valuable guidance and advice to patients.

Ø Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

· NYS Licensed as a Dietician

· Bachelor’s degree in Dietetics-Nutrition or similar field required.

· 2-3 years’ experience in related field

· Must have extensive knowledge of child nutrition, and chronic disease management including but not limited to diabetes, obesity, and high cholesterol.

**Special Skills and Knowledge:**

· Strong computer skills required.

· Ability to maintain detailed documentation and records in an organized manner. Work as a team member and independently.

· Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

· Basic knowledge of medical terminology

· Excellent active listening skills and strong service orientation

Bronx Community Health Network is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military, and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,244.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Client Partner, Health
description:
Ad Sales
Sell what you love. For us and millions of users across the globe, that’s Spotify. Join the Sales team and you’ll build the relationships that help grow our business in existing markets and beyond. We don’t just sell creative solutions to our clients and partners, we help to shape them; using our expert knowledge of ad products, sales channels and the industry to impact the way the world experiences music and podcasts.
Locations


New York
Chicago
Job type


Permanent  


Spotify is looking for an outstanding Client Partner to join our Health vertical team in either New York or Chicago. We are looking for someone with a proven record of revenue generation and a deep interest and passion for digital media and innovation. We want someone who loves our product and knows how to sell creative solutions for clients and partners. You should be confident while staying humble, you work hard, and know how to have fun. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music and podcasts on Spotify.
What You'll Do

* Sell display advertising (video, mobile, programmatic), audio formats, and other ad space in order to grow advertising revenues by creating, maintaining, and sustaining relationships with media agencies, creative agencies, and clients directly
* Work across multiple agency departments, i.e. radio, digital, branded content and innovation teams, to deliver successful campaigns
* Partner with internal marketing, brand partnerships, and label relations teams to maximize revenue for Spotify and our partners
* Focus on consultative brand selling, educating and inspiring our clients to use Spotify to enhance their business
* Meet and exceed advertising revenue goals
* Attend weekly and monthly sales meetings/trainings as required
* Represent Spotify at events and serve as a brand ambassador, communicating our core narratives and reinforcing the strong position Spotify holds in the marketplace
* Accurate forecasting, reporting daily and weekly and timely insights about your business and customers is vital. Use of Salesforce is required as a primary method of managing your day to day

Who You Are

* You have a Bachelor’s degree
* You have 6+ years of professional sales experience in an online sales role
* You have knowledge of online and offline media and have the ability to be creative with audio and digital client solutions
* You have strong negotiation skills, have the ability to consultatively sell, present effectively and close the deal
* You know how to prepare for, deliver effective meetings, and tell an inspiring story
* You have the ability to build, manage and close a pipeline of prospects, and proven track record of exceeding goals
* You have dexterity in creating reports and presentations using Excel, PowerPoint, Keynote, etc.
* You have a deep understanding of digital ecosystem
* You are a team player, smart, adapt well with change and have a positive attitude
* You are able to work in a fast-paced, exciting environment and across external and internal teams to deliver creative, fresh campaigns

Where You'll Be

* This position will be based in New York or Chicago

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Learn about life at Spotify


The United States base range for this position is $125,558 to $179,368, plus equity, plus bonus or commission. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays. These ranges may be modified in the future.  

Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Americas Lead, Creative Operations
description:
Advertising Marketing
Spotify’s Creative Lab is seeking a seasoned program manager to lead the Americas Creative Operations team. The Creative Operations team works directly with Spotify’s largest brand partners, overseeing the production of all ad campaign assets (digital, video, audio, etc.) and delivering a positive and seamless client experience. This manager will leverage their expertise across client services and production, a deep understanding of sales and client priorities, and strong people management skills to lead an impactful, efficient, and innovative team. This position will require a deep understanding of the production process across multiple mediums, the ability to drive productivity amidst ambiguity, and the expertise to interpret and diplomatically convey complex feedback to a client, internal stakeholder, or external production partner.
Locations


New York
Los Angeles
Job type


Permanent  


Spotify is a fast-paced, high-growth environment, and this role will be responsible for creatively adapting to evolving business needs to drive impact. This role reports to an Associate Director on the Creative Operations team. Creative Operations is part of Spotify’s Creative Lab team, which leads creative, strategy, operations, and production for the Spotify advertising business. We work collaboratively with brands and agencies to inspire, create, and scale creativity with Spotify-first thinking. Our purpose is to build brand experiences that use the creative, cultural and contextual potential of Spotify that fans love.
What You'll Do

* Manage a medium-sized team of full time and contract project managers across the US, CA, and LATAM – driving development and impact across your org
* Partner with Sales, Account Management, and Strategy leadership to evolve the PM support model, thoughtfully share and receive feedback, and improve XFN processes
* Provide effective coaching and support for direct reports & serve as an escalation path for partner teams
* Build strong, well-managed relationships with peers and senior partners, viewed as a subject matter expert and go-to resource for across Spotify’s Ads BU
* Lead high-profile client and senior internal partner conversations, and curate/conduct XFN training on behalf of the team
* Identify business problems to be addressed and clearly scope out the workstream, to be driven by self or team; Prioritize projects based on their contribution to business goals and internal/external impact
* Design and uphold standard of excellence in client & production support across internal team and 3P production partners
* Effectively present & communicate challenges, impact, and team roadmap to XFN leadership
* Manage any concerns and align on best ways forward, informed by subject matter expertise, understanding of XFN dynamics and Spotify’s clients
* Proactively drive projects forward, anticipate needs, understand the risks and problem solve across teams
* Efficiently multitask under pressure, while taking the unexpected in stride
* Meet and manage deadlines in a casual but effective manner
* Assess, manage, and grow 3P production partner network

Who You Are:

* You have a min of 7+ years of experience in a client-facing, project management or ad sales marketing role. Preferably in a people-manager role with podcast advertising experience
* Experience communicating with high-caliber clients, translating their needs to creative teams and vice versa
* Production or production-adjacent experience, with deep knowledge of the ad & branded content production process across multiple mediums
* Experience sourcing, onboarding, and managing 3P vendors
* A trusted leader who can spearhead large-scale projects on time, within scope, and across multiple partners and teams
* Strong understanding of the competitive landscape and global trends impacting the industry
* Demonstrated ability to discover knowledge required to solve new challenges
* Self-prioritize towards innovative, challenging goals that drive positive business results
* Effective but diplomatic communication skills - the ability to tailor communication style based on audience, providing an appropriate context for team and partners to operate effectively
* Engaged and curious, exhibiting a growth mindset
* Comfortable in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment
* Humble and hungry teammate always willing to pitch in wherever needed
* Ability to thrive in a collaborative culture, embracing change and effectively implementing feedback
* Proactive and savvy problem solver; adaptable and easygoing; ability to see projects through to the finish

Where You'll Be:


* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EST or PST time zone as long as we have a work location.

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Learn about life at Spotify


The United States base range for this position is $116,941 - $167,059 plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.

title: Pharmacy Technician - Chinese
description:
**Job Summary:**  
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Pharmacy Technician to join our team. In this role, you will be the first point of contact for our customers, handling inquiries, processing prescriptions, and providing exceptional customer service. Your ability to communicate effectively and compassionately with patients and healthcare providers is crucial to ensuring a positive experience and accurate medication management.

Applicant must speak fluent Mandarin

Tentative schedule will be from 12-7pm M-F

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Answer incoming calls from customers, healthcare providers, and insurance companies in a professional and courteous manner.
* Provide information on prescription refills, medication availability, and pharmacy services.
* Process prescription orders and refills accurately, ensuring all necessary information is gathered and verified.
* Communicate with healthcare providers to clarify prescriptions, as needed.
* Assist customers with insurance claims and inquiries, explaining coverage and co-payments.
* Address customer concerns and complaints, escalating issues to the appropriate department when necessary.
* Maintain patient confidentiality and adhere to all relevant privacy and health regulations.
* Update and maintain patient records in the pharmacy management system.
* Collaborate with pharmacists and pharmacy technicians to ensure efficient workflow and customer satisfaction.
* Stay informed about new medications, pharmacy services, and industry regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; a degree in a related field is a plus.
* Prior experience in a pharmacy or healthcare setting is preferred.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to handle a high volume of calls while maintaining a positive and professional demeanor.
* Familiarity with pharmacy management software and basic computer skills.
* Knowledge of medical terminology and insurance processes is an advantage.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Commitment to providing exceptional customer service.

title: Registered Wealth Management Client Associate
description:
**Job Description:**


Merrill Wealth Management is a leading provider of comprehensive wealth management and investment products and services for individuals, companies, and institutions. Merrill Wealth Management is one of the largest businesses of its kind in the world specializing in goals-based wealth management, including planning for retirement, education, legacy, and other life goals through investment advice and guidance.


Merrill’s Financial Advisors and Wealth Management Client Associates help clients pursue the life they envision through a personal relationship with their advisory team committed to their needs. We believe trust comes from transparency. Our trusted advisory teams are equipped with access to the investment insights of Merrill coupled with the banking convenience of Bank of America.


At Merrill, we empower you to bring your whole self to work. We value diversity in our thoughts, business, and within our employees and clients. Our Wealth Management team represents an array of different backgrounds and bring their unique perspectives, ideas and experiences, helping to create a work community that is culture driven, resilient, results focused and effective.

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for providing client service support to potentially multiple Financial Advisors (FAs). Key responsibilities include supporting enterprise strategic objectives, operational excellence goals, and client advocacy within the FA's business, while customizing solutions based on their specific needs. Job expectations include serving as the most frequent point of contact within Merrill to address all service needs of their clients.

**Required Qualifications:**

* FINRA Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, 63/65 or 66
* Displays advanced industry knowledge and understanding of investment products

 **Desired Qualifications:**

* Energetic individual that is self-motivated, coachable and flexible in thought
* Enjoys a fast-paced environment with changing and evolving responsibilities
* Detail oriented
* Invested in personal development
* Consistently pursues client experience excellence
* Works quickly to fulfill client needs, delivering complex solutions
* Frequent communication and an abundance of discretion with sensitive information
* Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint experience with Salesforce a plus
* Professional verbal and written communication

**Responsibilities:**

* Provides excellent Client Service to the bank's clients through educating them on all of the bank's service and banking offerings
* Ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness in client materials and follows up on all client and Financial Advisor (FA) requests
* Assists with ensuring practices are in alignment with the bank's policies and procedures to support operational excellence, protect the bank's clients, and manage risk
* Identifies, deepens, and maintains client relationships through emphasizing the bank's offerings and promoting incorporation of banking into day-to-day practices, while communicating outputs to the FA
* Supports day-to-day team activities and needs including covering roles in times of absence or seasonal need increases, while leading with a client first mindset

**Skills:**

* Account Management
* Client Management
* Customer and Client Focus
* Issue Management
* Oral Communications
* Business Development
* Client Solutions Advisory
* Pipeline Management
* Prioritization
* Administrative Services
* Emotional Intelligence
* Referral Identification
* Written Communications

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


37.5

title: Portfolio Delivery Manager - Technology
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!


This job is responsible for leading a team to maximize the value delivered through multiple programs and/or value streams within a small, less complex delivery portfolio. Key responsibilities include managing and developing the team through coaching, mentoring and feedback, aligning strategy, and execution by applying Lean and systems thinking approaches to strategy, investment funding, portfolio operations, and governance. Job expectations include managing the portfolio, ensuring compliance to standards, and driving continuous improvement to operations and governance.

**Responsibilities:**

* Directs and leads a delivery team aligned to a portfolio and mentors Delivery Leads
* Manages and improves portfolio operations and governance processes, ensuring risks and roadblocks are escalated and resolved quickly
* Builds relationships with business and technology executives across multiple organizations, as well as Compliance and Risk
* Partners with the key stakeholders and leaders to define the vision and creating the portfolio roadmap aligned to strategic goals
* Provides status updates and reporting for the portfolio to stakeholders and leadership pertaining to the desired outcomes, delivery, risks, issues, and schedule
* Manages overall portfolio financials, Profit and Loss (P&L), and performance
* Ensures adherence with Enterprise Change Management standards

**Managerial Responsibilities:**

* This position may also have responsibilities for managing associates. At Bank of America, all managers at this level demonstrate the following responsibilities, in addition to those specific to the role, listed above
* Diversity & Inclusion Champion: Models an inclusive environment for employees and clients, aligned to company D&I goals
* Manager of Process & Data: Demonstrates deep process knowledge, operational excellence and innovation through a focus on simplicity, data based decision making and continuous improvement
* Enterprise Advocate & Communicator: Communicates enterprise decisions, purpose, and results, and connects to team strategy, priorities and contributions
* Risk Manager: Ensures proper risk discipline, controls and culture are in place to identify, escalate and debate issues
* People Manager & Coach: Provides inspection, coaching and feedback to motivate, differentiate and improve performance
* Financial Steward: Actively manages expenses and budgets in alignment with objectives, making sound financial decisions
* Enterprise Talent Leader: Assesses talent and builds bench strength for roles across the organization
* Driver of Business Outcomes: Delivers results by effectively prioritizing, inspecting and appropriately delegating teamwork

**Required Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of active involvement in project management with strong track record of delivering projects/releases per expectations
* 7+ years leading large scale transformation programs, involving business process and change
* 3+ years of Agile experience with understanding of Agile principles, concepts, and ceremonies
* Excellent communication skills with a proven track record of presenting at the most senior levels within the enterprise
* Build and maintain relationships by engaging different project stakeholders to establish credibility, solve problems, and achieve goals
* Proactively identify, manage, and address risks, issues, & dependencies
* Previous experience managing and responding to Audit and Compliance directives
* Ability to identify the need and direct resources to provide process documentation and define controls, shooting across a large enterprise environment
* Broad knowledge of the change policy, processes, environments, and tools as well as the risk control framework
* Work with business, operations, technology partners/delivery teams for desired business outcomes
* Report on project success criteria results, metrics, test, and deployment management activities
* Proven strong ability to connect business strategy to financial plans and models and ensure achievement
* Experience in leading and /or working in cross-functional teams to develop and execute project plans
* Strong interpersonal skills along with the ability to influence and drive continuous improvement across processes
* Ability to decompose complex issues and drive timely decisions; knowing when to engage others for additional input, and when to act independently

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Cloud Experience with an understanding of governance controls and tollgates
* Understanding of Internal and External (government regulated) Security, Risk, Compliance, Standards and Policies
* Experience in matrix managing teams within a large organization

**Skills:**

* Collaboration
* Influence
* Result Orientation
* Risk Management
* Stakeholder Management
* Analytical Thinking
* Business Acumen
* Data Management
* Financial Management
* Solution Delivery Process
* Agile Practices
* Architecture
* DevOps Practices
* Solution Design
* Technical Strategy Development

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for planning and coordinating the execution of project/small program deliverables which requires the engagement of multiple teams. Key responsibilities include communicating work objectives, coordinating delivery, facilitating sync points across teams, providing end-to-end visibility into the health of the deliverables, and managing program risk and compliance to standards. Job expectations include ensuring delivery meets the client’s expectations in terms of the functionality, quality, timeline, and cost.

**Responsibilities:**

* Leads and coordinates routines to support delivery (for example, kick-offs, status reviews, stakeholder meetings, change controls, and tollgates, etc.)
* Manages coordination of delivery and dependencies across multiple teams
* Facilitates communication and collaboration across organizations to support the deliverable completion and timeline
* Provides status updates for the deliverables to stakeholders and leadership pertaining to delivery, risks, issues, and schedule
* Works with sponsors and stakeholders to ensure that execution is aligned with deliverable requirements
* Supports resource planning for delivery and execution
* Ensures adherence with Enterprise Change Management standards

**Skills:**

* Collaboration
* Project Management
* Result Orientation
* Solution Delivery Process
* Stakeholder Management
* Analytical Thinking
* Business Acumen
* Financial Management
* Influence
* Risk Management
* Agile Practices
* Architecture
* Data Management
* Solution Design
* Technical Strategy Development

**Required Skills:**

* 12+ years of experience working as Business Analyst or Project Manager on technical projects
* Knowledge of and prior experience in Futures & Options / Cleared OTC post-trade processes and technologies
* Excellent communication & problem-solving skills and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
* Experience with standard software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum)
* Experience translating high level business concepts into detailed business & technical requirements
* Ability to work under pressure and drive on time delivery
* Comfortable working in a virtual environment with a globally distributed team
* Works well independently with strong time management, prioritization, and organizational skills
* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance or business-related field of study. Masters a Plus


Desired Skills:

* Demonstrated leadership and client relationship skills
* Strategic, enterprise-wide thinking and approach to delivery
* Strong professional work ethic, flexible, reliable, can work individually or within a team and able to perform as a team lead when necessary
* Previous experience with vendor product implementations
* Knowledge of and experience in Enterprise Change Management standards at Bank of America
**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40
