title: Part-Time Sales Associate, Brooklyn (Williamsburg)
description:
**Part-Time Sales Associate**

  


Parachute's mission is to help you feel at home. It's what inspires our retail store teams to come together every day to enhance the quality of our customers' lives at home. Because we believe that when we take care of our home, it takes care of us.



As a member of our retail team, you'll play an integral role in building a Parachute community within your local area. You'll work collaboratively, provide subject matter expertise on all things cozy, and have fun while doing it. We put the customer at the center of everything we do, and we want you to be part of that at Parachute!

  


**What this role entails:**



Our Sales Associates bring an amazing energy to the team and our customers – a warm welcome and fond farewell for all that enter our doors. Picking up on feedback, not being afraid of hard work, and listening to customers to make great recommendations will lead to success in this role. Our stores are designed to feel like home – not a traditional retail environment – so everyone feels comfortable here.



This position reports directly to the Store Manager.

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Provide best-in-class customer care and elevated service.
* Deliver an upbeat, personalized experience – one customer at a time.
* Develop meaningful customer connections and build neighborhood community.
* Possess expert knowledge of Parachute branding and products.
* Help maintain and manage organization, cleanliness of stock room and sales floor.
* Maintain backroom organization at sku level.
* Process incoming shipments.
* Process incoming returns and exchanges, both ecommerce and retail.
* Process Buy Online/Pick Up in Store (BOPIS) and Ship From Store oOrders.
* Assist with weekly cycle counts.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Must be available to work weekends and during the holiday season.
* Retail sales, showroom or customer service experience is preferred.
* Experience using point of sale systems, inventory management software, scanners, barcode labels, shipping programs.
* Ability to lift 50 pounds on a regular basis.
* Self-motivated team player with a positive, can-do attitude.
* Experience in – and a passion for – home interiors is preferred.

  


**What You'll Get:**


* $100 new hire gift card and free product for a great night's sleep!
* Generous 40% employee discount on most Parachute products
* Flexible schedules
* Quarterly bonus program + incentives
* Up to 9 days of sick time per year
* Holiday pay
* Voluntary commuter benefit program through Optum


This is an hourly (non-exempt) role that has a pay range of $18.00-$20.00 per hour dependent on experience.



Parachute is a certified Great Place to Work! Check us out here**.**

  


**Our Commitment to You**



We believe in the power of a diverse workplace. Which is why we are committed to actively recruiting and hiring people of all races, religions, colors, national origins, genders, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, ages, marital statuses, veteran statuses and disability statuses. As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive environment by committing to diverse hiring practices, encouraging education and communication with a monthly DE+I newsletter and building a DE+I enrichment and training program.

  



Ensure your Parachute Home job offer is legitimate and don't fall victim to fraud. Parachute never seeks payment from job applicants. Parachute recruiters will only reach out to applicants from an @parachutehome.com email address. For added security, where possible, apply through our company website at www.parachutehome.com/careers.

title: Caregiver
description:
**Work With Purpose**

  

At Five Star Senior Living, our people are the critical link to those we serve, and it is their vitality, energy, and caring nature that allows us to fulfill our mission of enriching and inspiring the journey of life. In addition to nurturing and advancing the lives of our residents, our team members enjoy meaningful opportunities for personal and professional growth, within a supportive culture centered around advancing *their* lives, as well.

**The Opportunity**


We are seeking compassionate Resident Assistants (RA) to provide support for our community’s residents with the essential day-to-day tasks they can no longer perform or need help with. RAs are responsible for helping people with their daily tasks, such as laundry, cleaning, bathing, dressing, and taking their medication. Successful RAs are sensitive and respectful, and are passionate about helping those in need.


**What You’ll Do**

**Provide Care**

* Helping with personal hygiene, including bathing, grooming, and dressing
* Supporting residents with medication; taking medication, opening containers, opening prepackaged medication, reading medication labels for residents, observing residents taking medication, checking the self-administered dosage against the label of the container, and reassuring residents they have obtained and are taking the dosage as prescribed.
* Repositioning residents in bed and escorting them around the community
* Toileting, incontinent care
* Take vital signs, such as blood pressure, heart rate and pulse

**Communicate**

* Observe and report on residents’ health, escalating any problems efficiently and effectively
* Detail daily reports to Nurse, or designated charge person, at end of shift
* Provide emotional support and serve as a source of comfort for residents and their loved ones
* Recognize abnormal changes in body functioning and report to a supervisor

**What You’ll Bring**

**Experience & Education**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Associates degree or higher, focused on advancement into medical services, or similar, preferred\\\\
* CPR/First Aid Certification desired (unless required by the State)
* Previous experience in long-term care preferred
* Valid, unrestricted CNA certification or State/Local equivalent required

**Engagement**

* Working experience alone, on a team, and on projects start to finish
* Strong emotional intelligence and listening skills
* Dedication to the medical field, especially towards working with the residents
* Must pass State and company background checks and drug test.

**We Got You**

  

We see and support the whole you. Because investing in you, and all our team members, is the first step in making a difference in the lives of others.

* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* 401k + Match
* Competitive PTO
* Life, Disability & other supplemental benefits
* Professional Development Funds
* Wellness Coaching & Personal Support Benefits
* Recognition & Reward Programs

**Is This You?**

  

Beyond checking off the boxes, we’re looking for someone who shares our deep sense of purpose and passion for advancing the lives of others.

* **Puts People First** – You have an authentic connection to our vision of a world in which the quality of life is ageless, and a desire to advance our culture by always respecting and empowering our team members, residents, and families.
* **Customer Focused** – You strive to build and strengthen customer loyalty by delivering exceptional hospitality, thoughtful solutions, and innovative customer attraction and retention strategies.
* **Results Oriented** – You’re forward thinking, seeing the big picture as you lead with empathy and drive to exceed results. You firmly believe that the way in which we achieve results is just as important as what we accomplish together.
* **Drives Operational Excellence** – You encourage a mindset of continuous improvement. You respect ideas, collaborate, and empower others to elevate how and what we deliver for our customers and each other.
* **Embraces Change** – You’re a change driver! A positive communicator who engages all key stakeholders to help them anticipate and embrace what’s next, you’re always adjusting the target for continuous improvement.

**EEOC**

  

Five Star prohibits discrimination against any applicant or employee with regard to or on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. In addition to federal requirements, Five Star complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has communities and/or facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


In addition, Five Star expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. We will not tolerate harassment of employees in the workplace, or in other settings in which employees may find themselves in connection with their employment. Improper interference with the ability of Five Star’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination harassment or retaliation, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any federal, state, or local law is prohibited and will not be tolerated.

title: Lifeset Specialist
description:
**Organizational Overview:**  

CarePlus New Jersey continues to be a leader in mental health and a pioneer in integrated care in Northern New Jersey for more than 45 years. CarePlus strives for excellence in mental health, addiction recovery, and community-based services. Our goal is to offer affordable, accessible, and holistic-centered care that empowers individuals to reach their full potential and enhance their quality of life.


**Job Summary:**  

Do you want to work as part of a team with young adults ages 17-22? Come join the LifeSet program, which assists young adults in successfully transitioning to adulthood and maturing out of DCP&P care.



In this community-based program, which offers flexibility, staff support, and career growth, each specialist works with 8-10 young adults in an evidence-based model to work toward their identified goals, including housing, employment, education, and more. Come help make a large impact on a young adult's life before entering adulthood!

  

**What You Will Do:**


* Provide individual services to 8-10 young adults in the home and community setting to assist young adults with the transition to adulthood.
* Meet at least once per week face-to-face with the young person and provide additional support via phone, text, or in person as needed.
* Directly responsible for all interventions for a specific young adult and any additional resources or supports.
* Support a young person in identifying goals and working with them to achieve them.
* Conduct ongoing assessment of the young person's needs from a strength-focused, solution-based perspective and develop service plans monthly.
* Document all service contacts with the young adult within the timelines required by the organization.
* Be on-call rotation and respond in person at any time when it is determined to be necessary by the Supervisor, LifeSet Model Expert, and Program Director.
* Attend and actively participate in trainings and individual and team supervisions.
* Develop and follow up and/or implement feedback and recommendations from the Supervisor, Program Director, and LifeSet Model Expert.
* Adhere to all ethical and legal guidelines, including confidentiality and mandated reporting.
* Work will be in Bergen, Passaic, Hudson, Morris, and Essex County.

  

**What We Need to See:**


* A bachelor's degree in social services with one year of related experience in counseling and/or case management or other related experience is required. A master's degree in social work, psychology, or a related field is preferred.
* A valid driver's license and must be insurable under Agency automobile insurance.
* Ability to maintain a flexible schedule.
* Bilingual Spanish preferred.

  

**What We Offer:**


* 401K
* High-plan insurance at a generous cost
* Union benefits
* Life and Disability insurance
* Per diem opportunities
* Excellent supervision and training
* Continuing education, tuition reimbursement, and eligibility for loan forgiveness
* 10% daycare discount


**About CarePlus New Jersey:**  

CPNJ embraces a culture of diversity and inclusion in all of it policies and procedures. Care Plus follows Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, et seq and NJ Law Against Discrimination. We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by Federal and State laws.

title: Director of Development
description:
### **Who We Are:**



School in the Square (S2) is a fast-growing charter school currently serving elementary and middle school students, with plans to serve families from Pre-K - 12 with the opening of a high school with 9th grade in Fall, 2023. S2 engages, educates and empowers its students to respond mindfully and creatively to life's opportunities and challenges. Drawing its name from the concept of the public square or "la placita", our mantra is "Relationships First". S2 is where communities come together to solve problems and celebrate successes. Here, students, families and educators are seen, heard, and inspired. S2 students build the academic foundations, social-emotional intelligence, and the leadership skills necessary to excel in college and professional life. Our community is grounded in principles of justice, equity, diversity and inclusivity (JEDI), enacting a culturally responsive and sustaining lens to our pedagogical practice and consistently examining the ways we can continue to walk firmly in the pursuit of social justice and against injustice of any kind.



We take seriously our obligation as an anchor institution in our community. We understand that our students' ability to learn is directly impacted by their access to basic needs. Through our Family Support Program, we support over 200 families every month with bimonthly food pantries and other essential services, including internet hotspots and rent relief.


### **Our Director of Development**



The Director of Development (DD) is a key position, reporting directly to and in partnership with the Executive Director (ED). The DD will spearhead development efforts as S2 continues to grow and will have the opportunity to formalize and build upon the existing development function. The DD will partner with the ED to systematize current grassroots efforts, plan, and manage efforts to realize organizational fundraising goals, with a focus on securing increased revenue from fundraising events with new and existing donors and to build engagement with S2. This position has significant responsibilities related to regular donor communications, utilizing donor research and cultivation, direct gift solicitation, grant writing, and public engagement strategies, in conjunction with the Board of Trustees. The DD also works to advance S2 's visibility and profile through written communications both online and in print.


### **Responsibilities of the DD:**


* In partnership with ED, drives strategic initiatives, and supports the development of long-term growth plans for corporate, foundation and individual outreach
* Analyzes and recommends emerging industry trends
* Engages targeted constituencies through development and management of programs and activities that deepen donor engagement and revenue growth; including and not limited to private individual and organizational events, and other events
* Creates and manages donor communications strategy and materials including house party presentations
* Serves as primary manager for current and potential donors, including individuals, corporations and foundations
* Writes grants and interim reports
* Assists ED, with stewardship, support and growth of the Board and development subcommittee

### **Who You Are:**


* A self-starter who is creative and entrepreneurial with ***2 or more years of demonstrated success in fundraising and development***
* Familiar with the local non-profit and educational landscape with comfort working in, and at times with, the school community
* A strategic, solutions-focused thinker with strong communication and planning skills and able to work both individually and as a member of consensus-seeking teams
* Skilled and analytical with the ability to gather and analyze data extracting insights and reporting
* An expert in project management who is organized, detail oriented, and experienced in administrative responsibilities.
* An enthusiastic, go-getter, problem solver.
* Adept in relationship-building and navigating & leveraging high-stakes relationships and negotiations
* Experienced in grant writing (preferred), communications & social media a plus

### **What You Can Expect From Us:**



At S2 we take as much care of our teachers and staff as we do of our students. S2 is committed to supporting our teachers by helping them build sustainable, rewarding careers that center on each educator's passions and multi-disciplinary interests. All of our faculty and staff are valued professionals and we are proud to provide some flexibility on remote work, team-building and collaboration, comfortable and friendly working conditions, to ensure our team members all have what they need to succeed.



In addition to meaningful and rewarding work, S2 provides ultra competitive salaries, an excellent benefits package with employer paid life insurance, a 401K program with a 6% organizational match, longevity bonus, generous paid time off, access to a federal student loan debt reduction program and a friendly work environment**.**



The pay range from this position is $90,000 to $130,000.


***Anyone who joins our team must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, including having obtained the booster.***


**School in the Square proudly values diversity. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.**
company_description: School in the Square (S2) is a fast-growing charter school currently serving elementary and middle school students, with plans to serve families from Pre-K through High School by 2023.

title: Associate Director, Agency Operations
description:
**Company Description**  

With a history that dates back over 80 years, Starcom is a global communications planning and media leader. We are an agency still grounded in our founding principle that people are at center of all we do. Each day, we apply this belief to harness the transformative power of data and technology to inspire and move people and business forward. With more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices around the world, Starcom partners with the world's leading marketers and brands, including Bank of America, Best Buy, Kellogg Company, McDonald's, Novartis, Samsung, Visa and more.

 **Job Description**  

Starcom is a world-renowned media agency that delivers meaningful brand experiences. Starcom helps get the right consumers' attention and creates brand-building results for many of the world's leading companies. Our people are transformational, dynamic, relentless, and fearless experts. We seek out and develop these attributes in our talent and put these qualities to work for our clients.


PMO: The Starcom PMO (Project Management Office) partners closely with stakeholders within and outside of Starcom to drive the development of key initiatives. The team develops and owns governance around project management to ensure a standard, effective process to deliver our products and services.


The Associate Director is a leader who applies project management best practices to key product and service delivery initiatives. The Associate Director possesses knowledge of various project management methodologies, including waterfall and agile, to drive projects related to the measurement of client initiatives and product development. In addition, the Associate Director partners closely with internal and client capability leads to ensure the team works cohesively to deliver on agreed scope.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Drive complex cross-capability projects and integrated program management.
* Provide project management subject matter expertise and support for large and/or complex programs.
* Produce project scopes, project work plans, resource plans and risk and change management plans.
* Ensure that an effective risk escalation process is established and that barriers to effective project execution are identified and addressed.
* Provide accountability for the evaluation and approval process for change requests.
* Lead internal and client discussions to ensure alignment to project plans and identify any escalations/resolutions needed.
* Engage with various stakeholders and work collaboratively across functions, regions and organizational teams to develop effective strategies and secure necessary resources to deliver project results.
* Lead/participate in scrum ceremonies (e.g., sprint planning, daily scrum, sprint reviews, sprint retrospectives, backlog refinement).
* Provide regular status updates to Starcom Leadership and clients as appropriate.
* Provide financial oversight of project to ensure team is working within budget and resource constraints.
* Contribute to proper training and onboarding processes for new team members.
* Apply project learnings to improve the project management process.
* Participate in management, leadership and effective communication trainings.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 5-8 years of progressive Project Management experience
* Strong written and oral presentation skills; client-facing experience required
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Excellent organizational skills
* Relationship management to foster a collaborative environment
* Technical project management to drive the development of analytics and products
* Project performance tracking to assess the successful completion of short- and long-term goals
* Experience managing projects with global scope/participation; ability to accommodate various time zones
* Working knowledge of enterprise tools (Smartsheet, Jira, Confluence, MS Teams, MS Visio, Zoom)
* Working knowledge of dashboarding using Smartsheet, PowerBI and Tableau

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 3-5 years of agile project management
* 3-5 years within a Marketing organization
* Mastery of waterfall and agile methodologies in various types of projects (e.g., product development, data integration, process improvement)
* Understanding of change and release management
* Experience working with offshore Engineers
* PMP and/or CSM Certification
* Working knowledge of enterprise tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, MS Project, MS Teams, MS Visio, MS SharePoint)
* Proficiency using Smartsheet

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Starcom is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.


The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:

* Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
* Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
* Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
* Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
* Tuition Assistance
* Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
* Matching Gifts programs
* Flexible working arrangements
* 'Work Your World' Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
* Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances


The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.


Compensation Range: $91,000- $144,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 11/04/2024.

title: FULL-TIME PUBLIC SAFETY DISPATCHER, CERTIFIED/NON-CERTIFIED
description:
**FULL-TIME PUBLIC SAFETY DISPATCHER, CERTIFIED/NON-CERTIFIED (Telecommunicator Certification is required within four months of being hired)**

Job Title/Dept: Full-Time Dispatcher: Police & Fire/EMS - **Currently 7pm to 7am shift openings**

**Job Description:** FULL-TIME Public Safety Dispatcher **SHIFT WORK REQUIRED**. Must respond accurately and quickly to all incoming routine and emergency calls, including 911, and appropriately dispatch or transfer as needed. Contact towing service for wreckers as directed and enters into CAD. Prioritize calls to determine priority and handle emergencies efficiently and effectively. Provide pre-arrival instructions for required medical calls per department protocol. Maintain continual radio communications with all Police, Fire, and EMS vehicles. Log Police, Fire, and EMS dispatch incidents and equipment movement. Respond to public inquiries, complaints, and emergencies. Notify traffic networks and all agencies of significant traffic problems: monitor different radio bands and security cameras. Enter vital information into teleprocessing equipment in a timely and accurately. Activate necessary equipment required to facilitate prisoner detention.Initiate overtime call-ins for communications operators. Operate the COLLECT System and maintain certification. Notify the on-duty Police Supervisor, Fire and EMS Chiefs of pertinent safety information. Communicate with other agencies, including surrounding Police Departments, Fire & EMS agencies, CSP, Social Services, Town Offices, Medical Examiner, Fire Marshal, press, DOT, CL&P, and SBC/SNET per department protocol. Equal Opportunity Employer

**Skills Required:** Must possess good data entry and communication skills. Dispatcher experience preferred.

**Education Required**: High School Diploma or equivalent

**Licensure Requirement(s):** Telecommunicator Certification is required within four months of being hired.

**Physical Demands:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Employees must be able to read and interpret documents and write reports and correspondence. While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in an office setting. Occasionally the employee may be required to stand, sit, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, climb, balance, and use hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Must be able to hear clearly both radio and phone communications. Must be able to sit in dispatch center for extended periods of time.

title: PT Sales Associate, Bloomingdales White Plains, NY
description:
SMCP - Sandro, Maje, Claudie Pierlot

**LOCATION: Bloomingdales, White Plains NY**


**Sales Associate**



At SMCP, our ambition is to become the global leader in the accessible luxury space. Our four Brands spread Parisian chic around the world by offering unique products & premium experiences to our customers in 43 countries. Our dreams of dressing the men and women in Paris have now transcended into a global reality across five continents.



SMCP has successfully developed a business model that blends elements of luxury and fast fashion based on the belief that Parisian elegance is only as desirable as it is sustainable and has therefore set ambitious sustainability objectives for 2030 to help preserve our planet.



Visit our Global Company website at https://www.smcp.com/en/ to learn more.


**SANDRO AND MAJE – THE COLLECTIONS**



The complimentary union of Sandro and Maje empower men and women all over the world to take control of who they want to be. Sandro is known for its discreet French effortless elegance while Maje takes a spin into femininity and grace. Each brand tells a different story, yet both inspire the same Parisian ambitions and goals.



To see who's wearing our brands follow our Instagram at @SandroParis #sandroparis #SMCP @MajeParis #majeparis


**A DAY IN THE LIFE - WORKING AT SANDRO AND MAJE:**


***Parisian Chic Environment***



As you step into the Sandro + Maje Shop-in-Shops inside of Bloomingdale's or Saks, the fast paced and upbeat atmosphere will truly energize you. Immediately, you are treated to a full- on sensory experience of Parisian ambiance! As the ultimate Ambassador of our brands, you will also notice that our team members are dressed in our fashions to showcase our beautiful collections. As a Leased concession partner, we also partner with our Department Store hosts on their store-wide events and promotions which is a huge business driver for us.


***Be Our Passionate Entrepreneur SALES ASSOCIATE: Here's Where You Come In...***



Be part of a fun and dynamic shop-in-shop environment helping to build relationships and creation of loyalty to our customers. Take part in creating fitting room experiences as well as wardrobing and styling clients from head to toe. Be part of the customer/sales associate experience creating a welcoming and inclusive culture. Other functions include: floor maintenance, brand knowledge on cross selling between Sandro and Maje, educating our clients on our exclusive collections, and overall contributing to a great place to work and thrive.


**KEY INGREDIENTS - THE SUCCESSFUL SANDRO AND MAJE CANDIDATE:**

* 1+ years of prior service experience.
* Love for Customer Service
* Friendly and outgoing communication skills
* Passion for Fashion
* Social Media Savvy
* Flexibility (as it relates to scheduling).


**WHAT WE HAVE IN STORE FOR YOU:**


* Competitive Base Hourly Pay + Individual Commission Structure
* Voluntary Health Plan + 401K Retirement Savings Plan
* Generous Paid Time Off
* Wardrobe (4 pieces per season based on eligibility)
* Generous Shopping Discount - 50% off Retail
* Career Growth: you will have the opportunity to work with an experienced Leader who will help you to achieve your full potential.
* Opportunity to Participate in Our Retail Stylist Program

title: Dog Daycare Team Leader / Staff Trainer
description:
**Daycare Manager** 

* **Hours:** Full-time
* **Purpose:** . To manage daycare operations through direct supervision of the daycare team members, ensuring the safety and happiness of the daycare guests. Creating an all inclusive environment by providing a fair and consistent brand of leadership.
* **Daycare team Leader: Basic Duties**
* Welcomes every visitor/client/guest that enters the resort. Makes all guests feel welcome and is available to parents during check-ins and check-outs. Caters to each guest’s needs on an individual basis.
* Maintains the overall cleanliness of the resort.
* Researches, orders, and stocks supplies.
* Educates clients and answers questions about our resort and services via telephone, text, e-mail, chat , and in person.
* Provides a safe, stimulating, and fun environment for all guests and team members. Follows up on possible safety issues in a timely manner.
* Develops and implements policies and procedures as needed.
* Trains, supports, and advises team members. Responsible for monitoring performance and counseling all team members as needed. Participates in team member reviews as a member of the Pack Leader team.
* Assists in basic hiring functions
* Conducts tours of the resort for potential clients and guests.
* Develops and implements personal goals or MBOs (Management by Objective), which are reviewed and approved by the General Manager.
* Stays current in general dog behavior and cutting-edge industry trends in order to provide exceptional care.
* Assists other Leaders in leading daily tasks and duties for the entire resort, including preparing for and assisting in team meetings and training workshops.
* Completes Manager On-Call duties when scheduled.
* Additional tasks as assigned.
* **Daycare Manager leadership Responsibilities and Duties**
* Leads by example. Projects a positive image of our company to clients and employees. Communicates the "big picture" to employees.
* Creates an inclusive environment where all team members feel valued, and addresses behaviors of team members that detract from a productive environment.
* Performs or participates in socialization temperament assessment for all new daycare guests prior to their first day of daycare. Documents important information regarding the test on the Dog Socialization Assessment form.
* Determine root causes of operational deficiencies and implements change
* Monitors the structured and unstructured activities of our guests, ensuring their safety, comfort, and happiness.
* Monitors the daycare team to ensure all team members are following safety standards care standards.
* Instructs Daycare Caretakers regarding safe play behaviors and training techniques. Seeks out new techniques and activities to improve daycare play.
* Completes and follows-up on behavior reports.
* Basic daycare duties and tasks.
* Communicates important information to incoming and/or outgoing shift team members and to other Pack Leaders.
* Documents important information regarding daycare guests and daycare operations in the Petexec note system. Reviews Log to follow up on issues and incidences.
* Completes a Daycare Report Card for all daycare guests in his/her care. Reviews other team member’s Report Cards to ensure quality and consistency.
* Documents information on Incident Reports when necessary, informs team about the incident, and assists as needed. Follows up on Incident Reports by calling parents, seeking veterinary care, and providing first aid as needed.
* Communicates with clients regarding their dog’s behavior in daycare.
* Performs dog training tasks (DIGS U ) as scheduled.
* Mentors daycare team members, offering ongoing training and feedback. Delivers performance appraisals
* Works playgroups as scheduled, providing a safe play environment while interacting with clients and potential clients.
* Works to improve how daycare functions within the hotel.
* Collaborates with the Hotel and Operations manager to ensure that hotel guests are properly incorporated into the daycare packs for their group time.
* **Education and Experience**
* **Previous leadership experience required**
* High School diploma or GED, with continuing education in the veterinary, dog behavior, management, or related field preferred.
* Pet First Aid/CPR certified or willing to acquire certification.
* Previous dog handling and training experience.
* Team member training experience.
* **Knowledge and Skills**
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to problem solve, multi-task, and take initiative.
* Demonstrates safe working habits for oneself, other team members, the guests, and clients.
* Possesses a positive attitude and is able to keep calm when working under pressure.
* Ability to communicate with the public and team members in a positive and educational manner.
* Previous experience in client services.
* Detail-oriented and quality-focused, while meeting deadlines.
* Reliable and friendly team player.
* Works well individually and as part of a team.
* Ability to lead and mentor effectively.
* Organized, flexible, and has excellent time management skills.
* Ability to delegate.
* Creative.
* Possesses leadership qualities.
* **Working Environment**
* Job duties are performed indoors and outdoors.
* Occasionally required to leave the resort for short periods of time during all seasons.
* An inherent risk of injury exists when caring for dogs. Although Digs provides thorough safety training and devices, team members may experience injuries as a result of dog bites, scratches, and/or other activity.
* Some overnight hours may be required.

title: Tax Supervisor
description:
**This is a Hybrid position with 2 days per week in our Melville, NY office.**

The ideal candidate is a team player who works to produce greater performance, creates and implements tax plans and works with the accounting and leadership teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and potential areas of risk. The Tax Supervisor will ensure compliance with state federal and international tax law through a series of systems and system controls that are designed to ensure accurate, timely reporting. They will monitor current and impending changes to tax regulation and make the appropriate updates to policies and strategies. The ideal candidate is single minded in their pursuit of ensuring compliance and achieves this goal through optimizing reporting procedures and driving the successful function of the tax team.

· Identify key issues facing clients and discuss possible solutions to increase quality and efficiency.

· Maintain a command of GAAP, GAAS, and any other common audit/tax techniques.

· Exhibit strong communications skills (verbal; written; presentation) with lower level associates, management/partners, and clients.

· Provide timely performance and behavior feedback to lower level associates via verbal discussions and/or evaluations.

Qualifications for Tax Supervisor

We are looking for a candidate with 3+ years of experience in a tax supervisor or public accountant role. Preferred candidates have a current CPA license.

description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Jacobi is a 457-bed teaching hospital affiliated with the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. The facility has earned numerous Center of Excellence designations, accreditation, and recognition for its renowned Level 1 Trauma Center, Burn Center, Surgical Intensive Care Unit, regional Stroke Center, Snakebite Treatment Center, Breast Health Center, Bariatric Surgery Center, and Cancer Service. The facility also offers the region’s only multi-person hyperbaric chamber, allowing up to nine patients to dive together at one time. Jacobi’s Ambulatory Care Pavilion is a stunning complement to its inpatient acute care, allowing staff to provide patients with high-quality service in a modern, state-of-the-art environment.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

A Licensed Clinical Social Worker to provide direct care or patients, provide supervision, training/education and backup clinical services in accordance with regulatory and professional social work requirements to various levels of SW staff.

title: Sales Representative
description:
Integrated Power Services is seeking passionate Sales Representatives to join our team.


We are seeking candidates in the following areas but are open to additional areas based on business needs.

* Cincinnati, OH
* Clifton, NJ
* Denver, CO
* Orlando, FL
* Miami, FL

 **Who We Are:**  

IPS opened its doors in 2007 to become the industry's leading service provider, offering single-source electromechanical and power management solutions to enhance the reliability of critical infrastructure. Today, IPS has the industry's largest network of remanufacturing locations, distribution centers, and field service offices across North America and the United Kingdom, serving over 30,000 customer locations across a wide range of end uses, including power generation, utilities, water and wastewater, petrochemicals, air separation, oil and gas, metals, mining, paper, aggregates, cement, hospitals, universities, commercial buildings, and data centers.

  

IPS offers excellent career growth opportunities and is expanding its talented workforce to meet rising demand. By joining IPS, you'll learn from industry experts and discover your potential while being part of a team committed to our shared values: Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Accountability, Customer Focus, and Entrepreneurial Spirit.

 **Position Summary:**


The Sales Representative is responsible for the effective sales efforts in their assigned area. This position will be expected to develop new customer accounts, advise customers on service center capabilities, and introduce new services to customers.

 **Our Ideal Candidate:**


We value individuals who possess a competitive spirit and demonstrate a relentless drive to succeed in the highest echelons of the industry. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, constantly seeking opportunities to outperform competitors and achieve top-tier results. We also highly value curiosity and creative skills, as innovation plays a pivotal role in our sales approach. The ability to think outside the box, explore new strategies, and adapt to evolving market trends is essential for success at IPS. We encourage our team members to continuously seek knowledge, ask probing questions, and challenge conventional thinking to uncover innovative solutions that set us apart from the competition.

 **Responsibilities and Expectations:**

* Develop a list of prospective customers with the manager, determine appropriate sales strategy, call on customers, and follow up with additional visits and correspondence as appropriate
* Foster strong relationships with customers to understand their evolving needs and preferences, making personalized cross-selling recommendations accordingly
* Coordinate the efforts of technical specialists for the development of proposals for complicated customer modifications

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
**Major Food Group** is hiring a **Purchasing** **Manager** to join our corproate team!


The **Purchasing** **Manager** is a key member of Major Food Group’s Purchasing Team. Reporting to the Director of Purchasing, this role will collaborate with our chef and management teams to streamline and improve operational efficiencies while delivering financial results through best practices of purchasing, receiving and inventory management.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Train culinary teams on inventory management system as it pertains to day-to-day operations
* Ensure purchasing and receiving best practices are being utilized in the business units including:
+ Bid process
+ Establishing Pars
+ Inventory organization
+ Reduction of delivery days and second runs
+ Buying practices such as case vs piece purchasing, bulk orders, contracting
+ Aid in vendor selection

* Assist teams to reduce variances via weekly physical inventory accuracy
* Monitor food costs and item price trends
* Codify inventory, purchasing and receiving procedures throughout MFG
* Train kitchen managers and receivers on established procedures in ordering, receiving, storing, distributing and payment of items.
* Createan approved vendor list encompassing all categories.
* Assists Chefs in maintaining/lower budgeted food/controllable costs.
* Develop, advocate, and implement sourcing strategies for assigned commodities to achieve short and long-term objective
* Ensures compliance with all brand established systems and procedures.
* Maintains accurate written food specifications and uses them effectively for price quotations and receiving.
* Generate food cost reports to assist in the evaluation of controllable financials on a weekly basis.
* Spend time within businesses for onsite training and support.
* Manage systems which allow for on-demand insights to support operational decision-making that will increase revenue and improve profitability.

**REQUIREMENTS**:

* 2 years of experience in restaurant kitchen management.
* Proficient knowledge in recipe costing, purchasing & inventory; experience with inventory management systems is preferred.
* Integrity and ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Ability to strategically think, logistically plan and proactively problem solve.
* Demonstrated experience collaborating and communicating within restaurants.
* Concise written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong Computer Skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and Google Suite (Sheets, Docs).
* Comfort working in a fast-paced environment.
* Detail oriented and organized.


BENEFITS:

* Competitive Salary
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance with Company subsidy
* Growth Opportunities
* Progressive Paid Time Off
* Parental Leave
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Generous Dining Allowance
* Unlimited Referral Program
* TransitChek Discount

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

title: Head Steward
description:
**Job Description:**


The Head Steward is responsible for the supervision and execution of the activities of the stewarding team; ensuring the cleanliness and upkeep of the kitchen and surrounding work areas, dining room, locker rooms, restrooms, public areas and sidewalk; operating the dishwasher and cleaning all soiled china, glassware, flatware and kitchen pots, pans and small wares. This role is a full-time salary position.

 **Essential Duties:**

* Participate in our program of regularly scheduled preventative maintenance as determined by Executive Chef or General Manager
* Report to station at scheduled time with required supplies to complete the scheduled shift
* Follow directions and warning labels properly that have been printed on the cleaning supplies
* Must be able to communicate clearly with his/her managers and teammates
* Keep his/her work area production to the level required by the Chef (Executive)
* Maintain cleanliness and sanitation of work area and equipment throughout the shift in accordance with Health Department and restaurant standards
* Recognize and report maintenance problems with kitchen equipment to managers
* Supervise stewarding team


Before finishing a scheduled shift, assist neighboring stations to complete remaining primary goals in order to disperse workloads equally.

**Competencies & Qualifications:**

* A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a restaurants/hotel environment
* Knowledge of basic repair and maintenance
* Ability to read - invoices, receiving supplies, produces, including directions and warning labels
* Ability to produce a high volume of work in a timely manner, which is accurate, complete, and of high quality
* Actively practice food safety procedures
* Ability to lead a crew of coworkers, manage tasks, direct others to complete tasks with a professional demeanor
* Organizational skills
* Effective time management
* Ability to lift large items up to 50 pounds
* Ability to stand for long periods of time

  

*The Dinex Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. title: Server
description:
A neo-bistro with New York sensibility and global influences, Acru is the first restaurant from Chef/Partner Daniel Garwood (previously Sous Chef at the Michelin-starred Atomix), in partnership with NA:EUN Hospitality Group, which is behind some of New York and the world’s most renowned concepts including Atomix, Atoboy, and Naro.


Acru is looking for passionate and enthusiastic for Servers with endless curiosity and love for the restaurant industry, to learn and grow with our restaurant. Our Servers will maintain the service standards and demonstrate exemplary hospitality and service to our guests. This is an ideal position for someone whose passion for food and beverage is matched by their deep commitment to guest service & hospitality.


This position reports to the Restaurant Assistant General Manager and Restaurant General Manager.


Server responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

* Working in tandem with the entire front-of-house team to curate a memorable dining experience for all our guests.
* Opening and closing the dining room and establishing a good environment so the team is well-prepared to execute a successful service - ensuring all opening and closing side work checklists are completed.
* Work together with the kitchen team to conduct genuine and attentive service for our guests.
* Expected to be constantly growing, learning, and expanding their knowledge base.


Qualified Servers must be energetic, enthusiastic, and have a great attitude, in addition to:

* At least 1 year of experience.
* Possess exceptional floor presence.


Physical Requirements:

* Ability to lift 10- 20lbs if necessary.
* Safely and effectively use all necessary tools and equipment.
* Stand and walk for an entire shift, including moving safely through all areas of the restaurant.

title: Front of House Manager
description:
**LE ROCK**  

Le Rock is located in the iconic 45 Rockefeller Plaza space overlooking Rockefeller Center. Praised for our updated French fare, exciting, all natural wine program and warm hospitality, Le Rock has been critically acclaimed with 3 stars and is featured as one of New York's best 100 restaurants from the New York Times.  

After years working together at New York mainstays, chefs Hanson and Nasr have established a unique mark on New York City’s restaurant scene creating buzzworthy restaurants that are founded in collaboration, professionalism, and innovation. Their attention to detail and commitment to employee growth has created a company culture that is welcomed and necessary.  

  

Come join an exciting restaurant with an emphasis on quality and excellence. We are a value-driven company, committed to supporting employee needs to create great work experiences for our people with lots of growth opportunities.


We are currently looking for experienced Front of House Managers to join our team. The ideal candidate displays an excitement for food and hospitality. As a critical member of our team, a successful F&B Manager will ensure efficient restaurant operation, as well as maintain high production, productivity, quality and customer service standards, helping to motivate our staff to provide excellent customer service.


We are a value-driven company with an emphasis on employee needs. This is a great opportunity to be a part of an energetic, seasoned and diverse team that is committed to creating an inclusive and dynamic workplace to learn, collaborate and grow.


Le Rock offers a competitive pay and benefits package and is an equal opportunity employer.


ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

* Serve as a representative for Le Rock, upholding high levels of hospitality and service
* Coordinate FOH and BOH restaurant operations
* Deliver superior service and maximize customer satisfaction
* Respond efficiently and accurately to customer complaints
* Train new and existing employees on proper service practices
* Implement policies and protocols that will maintain future restaurant operations
* Organize staff schedules and supervise shifts
* Uphold sanitation and safety regulations
* Maintain a good working relationship with others by promoting teamwork and fostering a harmonious work environment
* Perform other duties and responsibilities as required to enable smooth restaurant operations
* Prepare tip reconciliations and employee clockins daily as part of weekly payroll
* Assist new hire, onboarding and employee orientation
* Uphold lines of communication, maintaining a positive working relationship with kitchen leaders and line staff throughout service


KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS

* Independent, self-motivated thinker
* Strong leadership and communications skills
* Leadership and Integrity
* Desire and ability to teach and foster growth
* Problem Solving, Multi-Tasking & Delegation
* 2+ years experience as an F&B Manager in a high-volume restaurant, hotel, or retail environment
* Fine dining experience.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office- Word, Excel, Outlook etc.
* Familiarity with restaurant management software (Toast)
* Knowledge of Schedulefly.
* Organized and detail oriented.
* Extensive food and beverage (F&B) knowledge, with ability to remember and recall ingredients and dishes to inform customers and wait staff
* Strong leadership, motivational and people skills.

  

Le Rock does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits. title: Bartender
description:
A neo-bistro with New York sensibility and global influences, Acru is the first restaurant from Chef/Partner Daniel Garwood (previously Sous Chef at the Michelin-starred Atomix), in partnership with NA:EUN Hospitality Group, which is behind some of New York and the world’s most renowned concepts including Atomix, Atoboy, and Naro.


Acru is looking for Bartenders to join our opening team. We are looking for passionate and enthusiastic beverage professionals with endless curiosity and love for the restaurant industry to learn and grow with our restaurant.


Our Bartenders will work in conjunction with the Restaurant’s Beverage Manager and Acru Beverage Director, Jhonel Faelnar, in leading the team in all beverage and service-related areas. This team member will provide assistance in maintaining the bar program, collaborating with cocktail creation, providing continued education for our team, and demonstrating exemplary hospitality and beverage service to our guests. This is an ideal position for someone whose passion for beverage is matched by their deep commitment to guest service & hospitality.


Bartender responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

* Bar setup/breakdown, maintaining stock of all beverages according to service needs, and ensuring the team is well-prepared to execute a successful service.
* Responsible for serving bar guests and providing a memorable dining experience.
* Have beverage conversations of varying depths with our guests, guiding them through our list, in a gracious manner.
* Produce consistent and well-made cocktails in an efficient manner.
* Assist in managing the day-to-day needs of the beverage program (POS management, communicating ordering and prep needs, stocking, menu updates, timely staff updates, etc.).
* Assist with bar prep (e.g. making syrups, batching cocktails, etc.).
* Assist with weekly inventory and ordering.
* Maintain proper glassware inventory and breakage logs.
* Assist with inventory audits at the close of each financial period.
* Assist with the creation and implementation of cocktail, spirits, and beer training for new hires and continued education for existing staff members - testing regularly to check for understanding and structuring classes and tastings to encourage high engagement levels.
* Expected to be constantly growing, learning, and expanding their knowledge base.


Qualified Bartenders must be energetic, enthusiastic, and have a great attitude, as well as:

* At least 1 year of bartending experience (preferably in a fine dining setting).
* Must be able to demonstrate an extensive depth of food and beverage knowledge.
* Ability to work in a clean, organized, and efficient manner
* Ability to assist with ordering and inventory
* Previous experience with cocktail creation is a plus but not required


Physical Requirements:

* Ability to lift up to 25lbs if necessary
* Safely and effectively use all necessary tools and equipment
* Stand and walk for an entire shift, including moving safely through all areas of the restaurant

title: Host
description:
Major Food Group is coming back full circle to Mulberry St. with the opening of Torrisi, just a few blocks from the original Torrisi Italian Specialties where it all began. Located in the historic Puck Building, Torrisi, a love letter to Little Italy, proudly presents an Italian-American restaurant with an extensive wine program, a New York-Italian cocktail bar and a luxe deli. Chef Rich Torrisi presides over an open kitchen and presents showstopping dishes, with many prepared or finished tableside to engender warm and welcoming hospitality.


MFG is hiring an experienced Host/Hostess with a strong work ethic to help set and maintain the highest standards of cuisine and professionalism.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

title: Director of Strategic Partnerships
description:
Empire Portfolio Group is the area representative and franchisee of Orangetheory Fitness, a leader in the fitness industry with a focus on heart-rate based interval training and Relive Health, a revolutionary anti-aging and wellness clinic that enables individuals to extend their healthspans with innovative medical treatments.

Empire is seeking an ambitious, results-obsessed Director of Strategic Partnerships with a passion for developing and maintaining strategic partnerships to drive business growth and enhance our market presence.

The Director of Strategic Partnerships is a vision-setting relationship creator between Empire and potential corporations and businesses. The role will focus on building corporate memberships of Empire’s 2 brands – Orangetheory Fitness and Relive Health – with external businesses – both large and small. Success in this position will consist of driving meaningful revenue growth, customer growth, and partner acquisition. Prior experience in creating fitness and or wellness partnerships is a plus.

Responsibilities:

* Create and cultivate strategic partnerships to drive revenue and customer growth
* Identify and engage with potential partners to expand the company's market reach
* Negotiate partnership agreements and contracts to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes
* Collaborate with internal teams, especially the Marketing team, to align partnership initiatives with overall business objectives
* Utilize software for tracking partnership activities and performance
* Manage customer relationships with key partners to maximize value and satisfaction
* Conduct market research to identify new partnership opportunities
* Oversee project management of partnership initiatives from inception to completion

Minimum Qualifications:

* 5+ years of experience in corporate partnerships/sales or business development
* Relationship Management: Ability to create and sustain long-term relationships and negotiate contracts
* Exquisite Communication: Ability to communicate the progress of strategic initiatives to internal and external stakeholders, including the skills to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly.
* Analytical: Proven track record in storytelling through data visualization and driving plans to build compelling business cases and influence key decisions
* Business & Financial Acumen: understand the client’s business, industry, competition, company priorities and marketing budget, define success metrics and set goals.
* Proficiency in CRM software
* Strategic planning abilities to drive successful partnerships
* Excellent project management skills to oversee partnership initiatives effectively

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Experience:

* CRM software: 1 year (Required)
* Sales: 5 years (Required)
* Financial acumen: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10107: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

title: Restaurant Server - Part Time
description:
**Title:** Restaurant Server - Part Time
  
  

**Category:** Retail
  
  

**EmploymentType:** Part-Time
  
  

**Location:** NY - Eastchester - Eastchester - 3304
  
  

**LocationType:** retail
  
  

**JobLocation:** Scarsdale, New York 10583
  
  

**JobSummary:** As a restaurant server, you provide first-class service to our customers with every order you serve, ensuring their experience is your top priority. You have a passion for people and enjoy making our guests feel welcome. Your excitement about and knowledge of the restaurant and food and beverage offerings is how you meet and exceed our guests' expectations. You provide appropriate recommendations and because of this, guests come back again and again. You care about people, and model our core values.
  
  

An employee in this position can expect an hourly rate starting at $15.00.
  
  

**WhatYouDo:**  

* Make the customer your priority at all times by greeting, seating guests and anticipating and responding promptly to their needs. • Make relevant food and beverage recommendations, ensuring an engaging experience that is attentive, timely and correct at all times. • Prepare and serve non-alcoholic beverages to guests according to Barnes & Noble specifications, including preparation of espresso-based drinks. • Prepare and serve alcoholic beverages to guests, strictly abiding by state liquor regulations, particularly those prohibiting service to minors, intoxicated persons and driving while intoxicated. • Maintain complete knowledge of table/seat/station numbers, room capacity, hours of operation, menus, price ranges and dress code. • Work with coworkers as part of a team and provide support by answering phones, scheduling reservations and processing payments. • Provide attentive service by checking back with customers during the meal for any additional needs along with providing checks and taking payments. • Ensure the restaurant is welcoming to guests by placing a priority on a clean and tidy environment by monitoring and maintaining cleanliness, sanitation and organization of assigned work areas. • Use and maintain front-of-house equipment as intended. • Know and comply with all restaurant policies, service procedures and standards. • Complete Food Safety/Liquor courses in a timely manner if mandated by state/local Health Department. • Work in the restaurant which requires physical activity (e.g., prolonged standing, repetitive bending, lifting to 25 pounds, climbing, operating espresso machines).


**Knowledge&Experience:**  

* Passionate about the products we serve. • Positive and can-do attitude. • Enjoy working with people. • Listen to people and enjoy solving problems. • Make thoughtful recommendations for food and beverage items that satisfy the customer. • Well organized, efficient and able to multi-task. • Can clearly and respectfully communicate and express oneself. • Minimum of 18 years of age to serve alcoholic beverages. • One year's experience in a restaurant setting or equivalent preferred. • Knowledge of coffee roasting/brewing and experience with commercial espresso equipment preferred.


Expected Behaviors
  
  

* Treat customers as the first priority at all times. • Take initiative and consistently grow and expand restaurant knowledge. • Enjoy making recommendations and engaging with others. • Support company goals and initiatives and is a team player. • Show respect and kindness to fellow employees and customers. • Accept responsibility and execute all assignments correctly and with care. • Accept coaching and feedback from others openly. • Flexible and can adapt to an ever-changing environment.

title: Monday-Thursday nanny needed for 3 year old girl
description:
A kind family in Weehawken NJ (Near Lincoln Harbor light rail and buses) is searching for a nanny for their fun loving 3-year old daughter starting in September. The scheduled hours are Monday-Thursday 9am-5pm for a guarantee of 32 hours weekly. Family would love someone that has flexibility for an occasional date night. Seeking an energetic nanny that is proactive in engaging young children by reading books, arts and crafts, talking, playing, finding nanny/kid communities, outdoors, healthy meals and assisting with all physical, mental, and emotional needs for a healthy development. Mom is working from home and dad is in office most days. No pets in home. Child-related household help requested. Seeking a nanny that will encourage healthy and diverse eating. title: Client Executive - Manhattan NY
description:
Client Executive


Lamb is the leading insurance broker for social service organizations dedicated exclusively to non-profits and social service organizations nationwide. Lamb is a socially conscious organization boasting an amazing culture of relentless grit and continuous improvement. We go to work every day to positively affect people's lives and we strive to do the same for our employees. Lamb has been recognized as one of the best places to and we are proud of our culture!


In this role you will be responsible for soliciting prospective clients utilizing our industry-leading proprietary resources, building strong relationships, and gathering the information necessary to properly quote and sell insurance coverage that your prospects need to effectively manage their risk and exposure. Training is provided.


Responsibilities

* Client Executives are responsible for meeting production goals and the direct selling of insurance to new and existing clients.

* Lead consulting efforts with prospects to identify their insurance needs and work with Lamb’s in- house carrier relations team to deliver the best insurance solutions from industry-leading carriers.
* Work closely with Lamb-assigned Account Managers to service “your book” of acquired clients to deliver both effective on-going insurance solutions and the highest possible level of client satisfaction.
* Participate in Lamb’s in-house training programs to maintain expertise regarding products in the insurance market as well as optimize effective sales and servicing strategies.


Qualifications

* Bachelor's Degree
* Prior sales experience preferred


Compensation

* $60,000 - $70,000 base salary + uncapped commission

title: Principal Corporate Development Manager
description:
**Let's face it, a company whose mission is human transformation better have some fresh thinking about the employer/employee relationship.**  

  

We do. We can't cram it all in here, but you'll start noticing it from the first interview.
  

  

Even our candidate experience is different. And when you get an offer from us (and accept it), you get way more than a paycheck. You get a personal BetterUp Coach, a development plan, a trained and coached manager, the most amazing team you've ever met (yes, each with their own personal BetterUp Coach), and most importantly, work that matters.
  

  

This makes for a remarkably focused and fulfilling work experience. Frankly, it's not for everyone. But for people with fire in their belly, it's a game-changing, career-defining, soul-lifting move.  

  

**Join us and we promise you the most intense and fulfilling years of your career, doing life-changing work in a fun, inventive, soulful culture.**  

  

If that sounds exciting—and the job description below feels like a fit—we really should start talking.



We are looking for a passionate and driven individual to join our Corporate Development team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology, innovation and the Employe Experience ecosystem. You have a track record of successfully owning projects with measurable impact from ideation to execution and rollout. You are comfortable handling multiple – and competing – projects at the same time, adjusting your priorities on the fly. You know when to sweat the details and when to back off and look at the bigger picture. Long-term, having impact is what motivates you, so you are always thinking about how to move things along.



You will help drive BetterUp's corporate development strategy and execution and have a significant impact on the company and its future. You will own specific M&A opportunities and strategic initiatives end-to-end, developing insightful analyses and communicating clearly and compellingly. You will be involved in sensitive projects and need to maturely handle confidential information. You will work closely with the members of our leadership team, who rely on you to make smart recommendations and to lead change.


**What you'll do:**


* Lead the evaluation and execution of M&A opportunities and strategic initiatives, including opportunity assessment, business case development, valuation and financial modeling, and leading due diligence processes
* Source, research, and recommend potential M&A and strategic opportunities
* Frame questions, technical analysis, and meaningful and unbiased decision points for executives / stakeholders to make informed, efficient decisions
* Be a subject matter expert on our industry, adjacent spaces and relevant other companies
* Effectively with cross-functional teams and leadership to evaluate and execute opportunities


**If you have some or all of the following, please apply:**


* 5-7 years of experience with a combination of top-tier technology, investment banking, and management consulting roles; must have prior experience with driving buy-side M&A transactions end-to-end in a previous corporate development role
* Ability to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environment
* Excellent analytical skills combined with a practical, quantifiable and structured approach to problem solving ("thesis building")
* Ability to perform rigorous financial, valuation, and broad quantitative analyses and familiarity with accounting & key operational metrics
* Ability to context switch and ramp up quickly on new topics
* Attentive to details and highly organized, with strong independent planning and process management skills
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills that can educate, influence, and shape strategy; ability to kick off founder relationships
* Ability to develop strong relationships and work across all organizational levels


**Benefits:**



At BetterUp, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community.


* Access to BetterUp coaching; one for you and one for a friend or family member
* A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
* Medical, dental and vision insurance
* Flexible paid time off
* Per year:
+ All federal/statutory holidays observed
+ 4 BetterUp Inner Work days (https://www.betterup.co/inner-work)
+ 5 Volunteer Days to give back
+ Learning and Development stipend
+ Company wide Summer & Winter breaks

* Year-round charitable contribution of your choice on behalf of BetterUp
* 401(k) self contribution


We are dedicated to building diverse teams that fuel an authentic workplace and sense of belonging for each and every employee. We know applying for a job can be intimidating, please don't hesitate to reach out — we encourage everyone interested in joining us to apply.  

  

BetterUp Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, BetterUp Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.



At BetterUp, we compensate our employees fairly for their work. Base salary is determined by job-related experience, education/training, residence location, as well as market indicators. The range below is representative of base salary only and does not include equity, sales bonus plans (when applicable) and benefits. This range may be modified in the future.



The base salary range for this role is $186,000 – $(MAXIMUM ZONE A).



If you live in New York, the base salary range for this role is:  

$214,000 – $322,000: New York City  

$186,000 – $280,000: Nassau, Newburgh, Albany, Buffalo, Rochester, Syracuse


*Protecting your privacy and treating your personal information with care is very important to us, and central to the entire BetterUp family. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that your personal information will be processed in accordance with our* *Applicant Privacy Notice**. If you have any questions about the privacy of your personal information or your rights with regards to your personal information, please reach out to* *support@betterup.co*

title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) $23/hour
description:
**Organizational Overview:** Heed Health offers event solutions that prioritize guest safety and well-being for various types of events! Our clients range from organizations, production companies, schools and universities, private event hosts, and planners. Our strategies have been proven to provide peace of mind for our clients, and we offer reliable and professional event medic and wellness services.

***We are currently seeking EMTs in the Hillsborough, NJ.*** 

**Are you an EMT seeking flexible and engaging opportunities to supplement your income?** Our dedicated team of event medics play a crucial role in ensuring the safety and well-being of participants at various events. While most of our clients' events proceed without incidents, our EMTs and paramedics are present as a precautionary measure to provide peace of mind and immediate medical assistance if needed.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Patient Assessment and Initial Treatment**: Quickly assess patients' conditions and provide immediate care to address any injury or illness that arises during events.
* **First-Aid Administration**: Offer first-aid treatment to patients reporting injuries or illnesses, ensuring prompt and effective care.
* **Basic Life Support**: Be prepared to administer basic life support measures, including CPR, to stabilize patients in critical situations.
* **Emergency Care Escalation**: Evaluate patients' conditions to determine if they require escalation to emergency care and make informed decisions for their well-being.
* **Coordination with Emergency Services**: Communicate and coordinate with emergency services to facilitate patient transfers when necessary.
* **Enjoy Diverse Work Environments**: Embrace the opportunity to work in a variety of exciting settings and experience the unique aspects of each event.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Dynamic Assignments**: Each event offers a different experience, keeping your job exciting and engaging.
* **Flexible Scheduling**: You have the autonomy to pick up the shifts that work best with your schedule!
* **Supportive Team**: Work with a dedicated team of professionals who prioritize safety and quality care.
* **Professional Growth**: Gain valuable experience and enhance your skills in diverse settings.

This is a Full-Time driver position with Fass Logistics LLC.

We need reliable, independent, flexible, hard workers who pay attention to details, can quickly problem solve a wide range of situations, and win in a fast-paced environment!

Ideal candidates are enthusiastic, communicate effectively, and are ready to get the job done. Successful delivery drivers enjoy being out on the road driving, put safety first, and care deeply about customer expectations and satisfaction.

Duties:

· Safely drive and perform safety inspections on Company vehicle, follow all local & state laws, road/driving regulations, and Company policies

· Provide excellent customer service and satisfaction despite stressful events / conditions

· Communicate effectively with support team to provide exceptional customer service and ensure deliveries are completed

· Use smart phone device for GPS Navigation, scanning packages, conducting administrative requirements such as clocking in/out, and communicate with supervisors and other team members

About Us:  
HASC began in 1963 to serve the needs of the needs of disabled children. From the start, the program was characterized by professionalism, with a focus on the individual needs of each child. The vision continues to affect the programs that we operate today. What started as a small program in New York City, has now blossomed into many locations in the New York region servicing over 1,100 children.

Services are provided at the child’s home, day care center, nursery and at our center based locations.

We are licensed by the NYS Education Department and by the NYS Department of Health. We are grant recipients from OMRDD, DSS, DYCS, USHUD and USDE which provide program enrichments.

At HASC, children and families are seen and treated as unique and special individuals. The staff are constantly challenged to address the needs of their students by using curricula and techniques unique to the field of special education.
