title: Mortgage Loan Assistant Administrator
description:
**Post-Closing/Mortgage Loan Assistant Administrator**

  

First Equity Funding is seeking a detail-oriented and organized Post-Closing/Mortgage Loan Assistant Administrator to join our team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the smooth and accurate completion of the mortgage loan process. You will be responsible for supporting both the post-closing and administrative functions of the mortgage department, ensuring all loan documentation is complete, compliant, and submitted on time.

**Compensation:**
$20 - $25 hourly

**Responsibilities:****Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare, organize, and submit final loan documents to investors, custodians, and servicing departments.
* Coordinate with internal teams, title companies, and external partners to obtain necessary post-closing documentation.
* Maintain accurate and detailed records of all post-closing activities.
* Assist in the preparation and processing of mortgage loan applications as needed.
* Provide administrative support to the mortgage loan department, including data entry, file management, and communication with clients.
* Ensure timely and accurate processing of all tasks while adhering to strict deadlines.
* Support the audit process by providing necessary documentation and responding to inquiries.

 **Qualifications:*** High school diploma or equivalent; associate’s or bachelor’s degree in business or related field preferred.
* Previous experience in mortgage loan processing, post-closing, or a related administrative role.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently and work well under pressure.
* Proficiency in mortgage loan software, as well as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* Familiarity with mortgage industry regulations and compliance standards.

**About Company**  

First Equity Funding is a private real estate lender offering Fix & Flip, DSCR/Rental, Multifamily/Mixed-use, and New Construction loan programs in 44 states throughout the US.


At First Equity, we pride ourselves on being more than just a real estate lender. We are investment partners who help analyze and identify investment opportunities, ensure fast approval and delivery of funds, and offer construction consultancy to help property rehabilitation run smoothly and efficiently.


Since our incorporation in 2009, we have helped grow the portfolios of thousands of real estate investors. Our commitment to client success and experience in lending, construction, and real estate investing uniquely positions us as one of the premier private lenders in the country.

title: Mortgage Processor
description:
Our institution is experiencing rapid growth! We are building our capacity by hiring an experienced mortgage loan processor for our highly productive and skilled lending team. The successful applicant will be responsible for managing the loan process, from origination to close, while paying close attention to the compliance of current lending policies and regulations. If you are a detail-oriented processor with a track record of accurate and timely mortgage approvals, we invite you to apply today!**Compensation:**
$55,000 - $65,000 yearly

**Responsibilities:*** Put together loan packages and submit to lender underwriting for approval or denial
* Interview prospective loan applicants and assist them in finding the best loan products for their needs
* Adhere to all lending and regulatory guidelines and policies while preparing the loan file
* Serve as a liaison between borrowers, mortgage brokers and loan officers, real estate agents, and mortgage lending underwriters to support loan approval
* Secure property and loan documentation to process mortgage loan files such as appraisals, inspections, title searches, site surveys, contracts, and property tax records

**Qualifications:*** Strong analytical and time management skills and superior attention to detail
* We prefer an Associate’s degree in accounting, finance, or business - High school diploma or GED required
* Mortgage lending experience and loan knowledge required, specifically with FHA, FHLB, FNMA, or VA loans
* At least 2 years of loan processing experience required
* Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills

**About Company**  

First Equity Funding is a private real estate lender offering Fix & Flip, DSCR/Rental, Multifamily/Mixed-use, and New Construction loan programs in 44 states throughout the US.


At First Equity, we pride ourselves on being more than just a real estate lender. We are investment partners who help analyze and identify investment opportunities, ensure fast approval and delivery of funds, and offer construction consultancy to help property rehabilitation run smoothly and efficiently.


Since our incorporation in 2009, we have helped grow the portfolios of thousands of real estate investors. Our commitment to client success and experience in lending, construction, and real estate investing uniquely positions us as one of the premier private lenders in the country.

title: Medical Scribe - Bilingual Spanish Required
description:
**Company: Oak Street Health****Title: Medical Scribe****Location:**1000 S Elmora Ave Elizabeth, NJ 07202**Full time, Monday - Friday, 8a-5p**
The minimum and maximum base hourly wage for this position is $19.88. This base pay does not include additional forms of compensation including bonuses, overtime, etc. **Role Description**


The purpose of a Medical Scribe at Oak Street Health is to support our primary care providers with clinical documentation so that they can focus on providing exceptional care to our patients. Scribes assist providers throughout the patient care journey - huddling each morning to plan for the day's visits, joining them in the exam room to observe and document, and touching base after the visit to assist with next steps.

  

Beyond the typical Scribe role, these important care team members serve as clinical documentation assistants to their paired provider. Internally, we call them CISs (Clinic Informatics Specialists) in recognition of their important role in supporting accurate, specific, and timely clinical documentation. In addition to observing and documenting all patient encounters in real time, our Scribes become experts in our value-based care model and the documentation and care of chronic conditions, including ICD-10 and CPT coding. Scribes use this expertise to help providers identify and help close care gaps. Scribes receive extensive on-the-job training in clinical workflows, value-based medicine, preventative care for chronic conditions, accurate and specific documentation, population health data streams, and team based care.

  

Because our patients and providers rely on our Scribes, the ideal candidate should commit at least 1-2 years to this role. This is an excellent opportunity for pre-med track individuals looking to gain practical, paid experience in a clinical setting before applying to an MD/DO/PA/NP program, as well as those pursuing careers in Health Informatics, Public Health, Healthcare Administration, Medical Coding, and other related fields.

*Check out this* pamphlet *for a sneak peek into the life of an Oak Street Medical Scribe!*

 **Responsibilities:**

* Documenting Patient Encounters ~ 80%


	+ Joining the provider in the exam room to observe patient visits
	+ Documenting patient encounters in a structured note, including the history of the present illness, assessment, plan, and physical exam
	+ Assigning appropriate CPT and ICD-10 codes
	+ Preparing After Visit Summaries
	+ Consulting with provider to ensure accurate and specific documentation
* Clinical Documentation Improvement ~ 10%


	+ Requesting and reviewing medical records
	+ Leveraging Oak Street's population health tools to support clinical documentation improvement
	+ Preparing for and supporting Daily Huddles and Clinical Documentation Reviews
	+ Consulting with provider on clinical documentation opportunities
* Administrative support for your provider and care team ~ 10%


	+ Placing orders orders and referrals
	+ Addressing tasks
	+ Supporting the care team with additional responsibilities related to clinical documentation
* Other duties as assigned

 **What we're looking for**


Knowledge

* Knowledge of medical terminology and common medications, either from a pre-medical degree or prior clinical experience [required]
* Prior clinical experience, including shadowing and/or volunteering [strongly preferred]
* Prior scribe or transcription experience [preferred but not required]


Skills

* Advanced listening and communication skills [required]
* Strong computer literacy and ability to learn new technical workflows [required]
* Fluency in Spanish, Polish, Russian, or other languages spoken by people in the communities we serve [required where indicated]


Abilities

* Ability to adapt to new workflows and to quickly learn new concepts and skills [required]
* Ability to type 70+ words per minute [strongly preferred]
* Ability and willingness to take direction and be a member of a team providing patient care, including adapting to the provider's working style [required]
* Ability to be a self-starter within your role scope
* Excellent job attendance including ability to work in-person in our clinics (Our providers count on you.) [required]
* Ability to commit to at least 1 year in role (2+ is ideal) [required]
* Ability to work approximately 40-45 hours per week during clinic hours (full time position) with predictable hours and break times [required]
* Compliance with hospital and Oak Street Health policies, including HIPAA [required]
* US work authorization [required]

  

Behaviors


We strive for team members who represent our service standards and are:

* Competent
* Dependable
* Inclusive
* Seamless
* Someone who embodies being 'Oaky'

 **What does being 'Oaky' look like?**

* Radiating positive energy
* Assuming good intentions
* Creating an unmatched patient experience
* Driving clinical excellence
* Taking ownership and delivering results
* Being relentlessly determined

 **Why Oak Street Health?**

  

Oak Street Health is on a mission to 'Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient's communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We're an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody 'Oaky' values and passion for our mission.

 **Oak Street Health Benefits:**

* Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients
* Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options
* Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits
* Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends
* New centers and flexible work environments
* Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement

  

Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.

  

Learn more at www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health

title: Application Developer
description:
**What makes us** **special**
-----------------------------

Welcome to Veracity life! Here work is more than just a task; it's a vibrant tapestry woven with passion, collaboration, and endless opportunities. At Veracity, we believe that a fulfilling career is not just about what you do but also about the environment in which you thrive. Dive into a glimpse of life within our dynamic organization as we look forward to hearing from you.

--------------------------------------------------------


### **Cultivating Collaboration**


At Veracity, collaboration isn't just encouraged; it's ingrained in our DNA. Step into an environment where teamwork is more than just a buzzword; it's the cornerstone of our success. From brainstorming sessions to cross-departmental projects, every interaction fosters connections that fuel innovation


### **Nurturing Growth**


Your growth isn't just a priority; it's our commitment. At Veracity, we provide the tools, resources, and support necessary for your professional development journey. Whether through mentorship programs, skill-building workshops, or access to cutting-edge technologies, we empower you to reach new heights and unlock your full potential.


### **Work-Life Integration**


In a fast-paced world, balance is key. At Veracity, we understand the importance of harmonizing professional aspirations with personal well-being. Embrace a culture that prioritizes flexibility, offering remote work options, flexible schedules, and wellness initiatives designed to help you thrive both inside and outside the workplace.


### **Celebrating Diversity**


Our strength lies in our diversity. At Veracity, we celebrate the unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences that each team member brings to the table. Join a community where inclusivity isn't just a value; it's a way of life, fostering an environment where everyone feels heard, valued, and empowered to contribute their best.


### **Embracing Fun and Fulfillment**


Life at Veracity isn't all about work; it's about finding joy in the journey. From team outings to social events, we believe in fostering a sense of camaraderie and belonging beyond the confines of the office. Join us in creating memories, forging friendships, and making every moment count.


  
Allowing our employees to feel empowered, inspired and stay at the forefront of technology allows us to complete projects on-time, on-budget, and to our clients complete satisfaction.


  
#### **Application Developer**


##### **Job Location**

* Iselin, NJ and unanticipated client sites across the US. Must be willing to travel and/or relocate domestically.
##### **Job Duration**

* Permanent position, Full time, Mon - Fri, 40 hours per week.
##### **Number of positions**

* 1 Opening.
##### **Job Description**

* Assist to develop & analyze web Applications working on core functional modules integrating the design process with developed applications.
* Translate business requirements & assist in preparing technical design documents using PostgresSQL, STRUTS, C#, SPRING MVC, ASP.NET, jQuery, Servlets, CSS, Apache Tomcat, AJAX. Write test cases, perform unit testing & troubleshoot problems.

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering or IT or IS plus 6 months experience in job offered or as Analyst or Programmer or Engineer.
* Prior work experience must include 6 months experience in PostgresSQL, STRUTS, C#, SPRING MVC, ASP.NET, jQuery, Servlets, CSS, Apache Tomcat, AJAX.
##### **Email Us**

* Mail resume to Veracity HR Veracity Software, Inc, 555 US Highway 1, Suite 450, Iselin, NJ – 08830. Ref: VS19.

Together, let's embark on a journey where success is measured not just by what we achieve but by the joy we find in the journey.

title: Coating Operator II
description:
Vitaquest International is an industry-leading development and commercialization partner for consumer products in nutraceutical and functional foods. With over 40 years of history, Vitaquest has the market insight, global reach and scale of operations to support emerging and existing consumer brands from the idea to the store shelf with flawless execution in every phase. Today, Vitaquest creates and produces more than 4,000 customer formulas for more than 500 brands in over 40 countries.

Vitaquest's employees follow an internal communications plan to encourage productivity and engagement within the organization. This is known as Vitaquest PROUD. We believe that each employee contributes directly to the organization's growth and success. We are looking for individuals who share our innovative spirit and hope will take pride in being a part of our Company.

**Title:**  Coating Operator II

**Shift:** 1st - 6:00 am to 2:30 pm

**Department:** Manufacturing - Coating

**Reports To:** Coating Manager

**Coating Operator Position Purpose and Objectives**

* Ensures that tablets are coated to specifications.
* Process the knowledge to perform blending/Encapsulation process:

1. Ensure proper spray rate.

2. Ensure proper coating pan speed.

3. Ensure coating solution is properly prepared.

4. Perform Blending operations when required.

5. Perform Encapsulation operations when required.

**Coating Operator Essential Job Functions**

* Must follow all GMP’s and relevant SOP’s to the position.
* Accurately follows directives in order to successfully inspect tablets or capsules for defects.
* Ensures the workstation is kept clean and safe during the tablet or capsule inspection operation.
* Cleans equipment/workstation following proper sanitation techniques.

**Coating Operator Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required**

* Adequate communication skills to enable communication with area Co-Ordinator/Manager.
* Able to read and write, basic math skills a plus.
* Must be physically able to lift and carry 50 lbs. repeatedly.
* Pay attention to detail.
* Demonstrates a high level of responsibility and knowledge of job functions.

**Supervisory Responsibility**

* None

**Working Conditions**

* Dynamic manufacturing environment with physical demands***.***
* The individual is responsible to seek assistance when handling objects in excess of 50 lbs.
* Must be able to perform repetitive motion, bending, and lifting approximately 50% of Shift.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* 1-3 years Coating experience.
* 1-3 years GMP experience.

**Success Factors** 

* Team mentality a must, able to follow direction, self-motivated.

title: Food Service Supervisor (School Cafeteria)
description:
Founded in 2008, Butter Beans provides nutritious, wholesome meals for charter schools, private schools, and summer camps throughout the New York City and tri-state area. In addition, Butter Beans operates corporate cafeterias and offers catering services at notable institutions like the New York Hall of Science Museum in Queens and UNICEF.

Butter Beans seeks like minded individuals to support our school cafeteria service team. This position of Food Service Supervisor reports to the company’s management.

The work schedule varies from 35 to 40 hours per week and the daily shift times start between 6:00 AM and 8:00 AM, Monday through Friday. The work schedule follows a traditional school schedule, Monday through Friday with the shift ending between 2:00 PM and 4:00 PM.

Our team members are off when their schools are closed for holidays or other events. This is a seasonal position with the opportunity to work at one of our activity camps during the summer.

Our benefits include competitive salary with opportunities for advancements, free daily meal, paid sick time, 401k plan with company matching, bonus programs are available

The Butter Beans supervisor role is a key leadership position at our company. This person is responsible for school service operations combined with customer service management. In addition, supervisors directly manage on-site Butter Beans’ team members, assists in training of new employees and is responsible for daily inventory reporting and other production reviews.

The ideal candidate is a proven leader with considerable experience in the food service industry. This person is dependable, punctual, maintains a strong work ethic, is a problem solver, and resourceful.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required:

\\* Previous supervisory experience in food services.

\\* Previous kitchen and cooking experience.

\\* REQUIRED: Food Handlers Card from the New York Department of Health with strong understanding of food safety procedures.

\\* Ability to develop and follow systems and processes to achieve efficient operations.

\\* Proficient in daily inventory reporting and weekly production review to company standards.

\\* Maintains strong food presentation and professional environment to Butter Beans standards.

\\* Ability to maintain a strong customer service environment, including building an effective relationship with school leadership, administration team, etc.

\\* Fosters a collaborative environment where team members are committed to common goals and each team member is properly supported.

\\* Able to effectively address performance issues of team members. Comfortable in the mentoring and development of team members.

\\* Diversity - Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; promotes a harassment-free environment.

\\*Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; changes approach or method to best fit the situation;

\\* Strong problem solving skills, calm and professional.

\\* Strong communication skills - verbal and written.

\\* Strong computer skills (proficient with google docs, email, google forms, and the ability to log into password websites, e.g. ADP).

Physical Effort: Work involves light to moderate physical effort such as lifting or moving objects, constant standing, bending and walking. Must be able to lift up to 30 pounds.

Benefits:

* Strong people culture
* Opportunity to learn new skills and take on additional responsibilities (career growth pathing)
* Strong work life balance, Monday- Friday work schedule (No late nights or weekends)
* Spot bonus for the following: Butterbean excellence award, Butterbean Tenure award, Referral Bonus, Monthly Team of the month and employee of the month award and recognition, Completion of food handlers card, and reimbursement for taking the test, Passing of DOHMH Inspection
* Holiday gift cards and company Holiday party
* Commuter benefits (Tax free metrocard)
* ADP employee assistance program Benefits ( Traveling, Car Rental, Amusement Parks, Movie Tickets, etc)
* Daily free lunch
* Free paid 30 minute lunch break (6 hours or more)
* 401k matching saving plan
* Up to 40 paid sick hours a year
* Yearly performance review with a merit increase

Pay: $17.00 - $23.00 per hour

* 401(k) matching
* Paid training

title: Host
description:
**About Crossover Health**


Crossover Health is creating the future of health as it should be. A national, team-based medical group with a focus on wellbeing and prevention that extends beyond traditional sick care, the company delivers an entirely new model of healthcare—Primary Health—built on the foundation of trusted relationships, an interdisciplinary care team approach, and outcomes-based payment. Crossover’s Primary Health model integrates primary care, physical medicine, mental health, health coaching, care navigation and more, and delivers care in surround-sound—in-person, virtually and via asynchronous messaging. Together we are building a community of members that embraces healthcare as a proactive part of their lifestyle.

**Job Summary**

  

The Host role is at the forefront of providing an exceptional member service experience. As an important member of our clinic team, the Host assists members with checking in and demonstrates an in-depth knowledge of self-insured employer health insurance, including copays, co-insurance, and related benefits. The Host role facilitates the member’s experience throughout our health center.**Job Responsibilities**

* Welcomes each member and handles all member interactions with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism.
* Demonstrates a commitment to quality, delivering uncompromised service and outcomes.
* Accommodates special requests for member support whenever possible and helps to promptly resolve member questions.
* Assists with assigned projects and special provider or patient requests.
* Assists with the member check-in process, including a basic understanding of benefit eligibility files, check-in technology and overall clinic workflows within the context of care delivery.
* Processes transactions required to begin or complete the visit.
* Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge of employer-sponsored health insurance, including copays, co-insurance, and related benefit specific requirements, in order to support members.
* Engages with members by answering calls, scheduling appointments, responding to emails, and following up with member needs.
* Collaborates with providers and staff members to deliver an exceptional seamless patient-centered care experience.
* Performs other duties as assigned

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* 1 year of experience in customer service position

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Excellent computer skills and familiarity with Apple products (Mac, iPad, iPhone), ChromeOS, or client-branded Windows products such as Microsoft or HP.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in a highly collaborative care team environment
* Proven organizational skills
* High level of ownership, accountability and initiative
* Experience with multitasking, issue resolution, and conflict management
* Experience in a health care service delivery environment
* BLS (Basic Life Support) certification

**Physical Job Requirements**

* Requires standing, walking and sitting for extended periods of time
* Occasionally required to lift and carry items weighing up to 50 lbs
* Manual and finger dexterity and hand-eye coordination
* Requires corrected vision, hearing and speech within normal ranges
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The base pay range for this position is $21.43 to $24.64 per hour. Pay range may vary depending on work location, applicable knowledge, skills, and experience. This position will be eligible for a comprehensive benefits package that includes Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Short- and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off and 401K.
Crossover Health is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, veteran status, disability, history of disability or perceived disability. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at careers@crossoverhealth.com.

**To all recruitment agencies**: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Social Worker
description:
Manhattanview Rehab Center, a 12-bed skilled nursing and rehabilitation facility located in Union City, New Jersey, is in need of Full Time Social Worker to assist the Director of Social Services. Candidate must have a current NJ **Social Worker** certification or license in good standing.



Duties include, but are not limited to:


* Develop and implement social service policies and procedures to meet residents’ needs in compliance with federal, state and local regulations.


* Develop, coordinate and participate in family and resident activities designed to promote social interaction, reality orientation and intellectual stimulation.


* Counsel residents and families in dealing with feelings about death or dying and other emotional, mental, environmental or physical limitations.


* Assess and complete the sections of the (MDS) Minimum Data Set assigned completely, timely and accurately.


* Document the social service component of the Comprehensive Care Plan for each resident in a timely manner.


* Document psycho-social needs, interaction and follow-up action(s) with resident and/or family according to facility policies and procedures.


* Assess, plan and document residents’ discharge needs in accordance with facility discharge planning policy and regulatory requirements.


* Act as a liaison with social, health and community agencies.


* Refer residents to social, health and community agencies and complete accurate documentation in residents’ records concerning the results of such referrals.


* Coordinate family and community resources as needed to solve financial needs and to promote emotional security.


* Explain residents’ rights to residents and residents’ representatives.


* Participate in admission of residents as assigned


* Plan, schedule and implement room visits for residents unable to leave their rooms.


* Organize and participate in the theft loss program.


* Be responsible for the safety of residents under his/her supervision.


* Demonstrates knowledge of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each resident in all interactions.


* Appreciates the importance of maintaining confidentiality of resident and facility information.


* Demonstrate honesty and integrity at all times in the care and use of resident and facility property.


* Comply with all facility policies and procedures.


* Additional duties as assigned by the supervisor



QUALIFICATIONS:


* Must have long term care experience
* Must have prior experience as a Social Worker
* Must have LCSW or CSW
* Strong verbal & written communication skills

title: Application Supp Spec - Engineering (Aurigo Master Works, Bidx, Bently, ESRI, Bluebeam)
description:
Under the general direction of the Assistant Director, Software Engineering Services, the Application Support Specialist: Engineering Platforms will be responsible for installing, configuring, maintaining, updating, and upgrading various applications in the engineering software portfolio. Daily activities include supporting end-users and ensuring applications are operational. This position includes a wide range of responsibilities and duties involving the maintenance and upkeep of engineering related applications, which are in accordance with the Authority’s goals and requirements.

* Coordinate with other teams in the Information Technology Services Department, as well as, throughout the Authority, specifically the Engineering Department, to identify IT needs, identify integration requirements, document business use cases, and design a robust application environment.
* Plan, coordinate, install and configure software, load data, apply permissions and perform maintenance work, such as system back-up, recovery, and file maintenance, while communicating changes, upgrades/maintenance schedules, and new services to all end-users, all the while maintaining minimal down time.
* Provide technical and business support to end-users, as well as, other IT professionals. Support will be through Service Desk tickets and training programs.
* Provide regular project status and estimates to management.
* Provide support in quality assurance testing, disaster recovery exercises, and business continuity plans.
* Monitor, document, analyze, and troubleshoot software applications.
* Create FAQs, How-tos, and templates to facilitate software adoption.
* Plan, coordinate, test, and communicate
* Lead audits to ensure appropriate controls and audit logs are in place.
* Maintain current knowledge of relevant technologies and business processes.
* Enable and maintain best practices and process automation.
* Assist with all incoming trouble tickets.
* Work with vendors and contractors as directed.
* Monitor and maintain software licensing and maintenance agreements.
* Ensure projects hit milestones on time and escalate to proper stakeholders as needed.
* Solid understanding of project management methodology, including the ability to troubleshoot project roadblocks and proactively seek solutions to meet deadlines.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Management.
* IT industry certifications are a plus.
* Drone experience is a plus.
* Minimum of three years of experience supporting engineering applications.
* Must have experience in Aurigo Master Works, Bidx, Bently Suite, ESRI, and Bluebeam.
* Strong analytical, problem solving and logical troubleshooting abilities.
* Must have working knowledge installing, designing, and performing maintenance functions on engineering software applications.
* Solid working technical knowledge of software applications, protocols, standards, and networking principles.
* Ability to work with diverse teams.
* Ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities, while working independently, as well as, part of a team.
* Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills.
* Valid New Jersey driving license.

Prospective public employees should be aware that the New Jersey First Act requires employees of all public authorities to reside in the State of New Jersey unless otherwise exempted under the law.

title: Technical Manager trainee
description:
Title: Technical Manager Trainee -

Position Overview: The Technical Manager Trainee is responsible for acquiring a comprehensive understanding of electroplating processes, equipment, safety/environmental protocols, quality standards, and production management. This role is designed to groom individuals for future leadership positions within the technical and production management teams.

Key Responsibilities:

* Training and Development:
* Participate in a structured training program to gain proficiency in electroplating techniques, chemical handling, equipment operation, and production management.
* Shadow experienced technical and production managers to understand day-to-day operations, troubleshooting procedures, and best practices.
* Engage in hands-on learning opportunities to familiarize oneself with the facility's processes, machinery, and production workflows.
* Process Optimization:
* Collaborate with senior technical and production staff to analyze electroplating processes and identify opportunities for improvement in efficiency, quality, and production output.
* Assist in implementing process enhancements, including adjustments to parameters, chemical formulations, or equipment configurations, to optimize production performance.
* Contribute ideas for innovation and modernization of electroplating techniques to enhance productivity, quality, and sustainability while meeting production targets.
* Quality Assurance:
* Learn quality control procedures and standards to ensure that electroplated products meet customer specifications and regulatory requirements.
* Assist in conducting inspections and tests to assess the quality of plated components and identify any deviations from standards.
* Work closely with quality assurance personnel to address non-conformities, implement corrective actions, and maintain high product quality throughout the production process.
* Production Management:
* Gain understanding of production planning, scheduling, and resource allocation processes to support efficient production operations.
* Assist in coordinating production activities, monitoring production metrics, and identifying areas for improvement to meet production targets and deadlines.
* Collaborate with production managers to troubleshoot production issues, minimize downtime, and optimize production workflows for increased efficiency and output.
* Safety/Environmental Compliance:
* Acquire knowledge of safety/environmental protocols and regulations governing chemical handling, equipment operation, waste management, and production activities in an electroplating facility.
* Participate in safety/environmental training sessions and drills to develop awareness of potential hazards and emergency procedures.
* Contribute to the development and enforcement of safety/environmental policies to maintain a secure working environment for all employees while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Project Management:
* Support technical and production managers in the planning and execution of projects related to facility upgrades, process modifications, equipment installations, and production improvements.
* Assist in coordinating resources, scheduling tasks, and monitoring progress to ensure timely completion of projects while minimizing disruptions to production activities.
* Gain exposure to project management tools and techniques to develop organizational and leadership skills necessary for managing complex projects in a manufacturing environment.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Industrial Engineering, or related field (preferred).
* Strong interest in electroplating technology and its applications in various industries, along with a keen interest in production management.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot technical and production issues and propose effective solutions.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, communicate technical concepts, and coordinate production activities effectively.
* Commitment to safety, quality, environmental, and continuous improvement in all aspects of work, including production management.
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges in a dynamic manufacturing environment, with a focus on achieving production targets and delivering high-quality products to customers.

This job description encompasses the Technical Manager Trainee role in an electroplating facility, including responsibilities related to both technical and production management aspects. Responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on the specific requirements of the organization.

Facilities USA and Guard Services USA are leaders in facilities management and security staffing, serving the retail, residential, commercial, and industrial sectors. Our offices are conveniently located at Grand Central Station, where a team of over 25 motivated professionals collaborates to support each other and drive our ambitious growth plans. title: Finance Software Systems Manager - PeopleSoft, Korber, Masterworks
description:
Works under the general direction of the Deputy Chief Information Officer to manage a team of internal and external technical developers that maintain, troubleshoot, and enhance the Authority’s Financial Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and capital planning platforms while ensuring 24/7 functionality, stability, and expandability which commensurate with the Authority’s goals and requirements.

Primary responsibility is to ensure availability of all applications by coordinating efforts among various IT and business resources for system maintenance, server upgrades, application upgrades, and integration efforts. Serves as lead technical and security administrator for all business administration platforms, ensuring software audit best practices.

1. Maintain, upgrade, and support systems, such as PeopleSoft Financials, Korber Supply Chain system and Aurigo Masterworks system.

2. Participates in the feasibility analysis for new systems/applications to determine how applications and processes can be improved.

3. Serves as a technical lead on small-to-mid sized projects.

4. Monitors the operating efficiency of existing application systems and provides (or arranges for) proactive maintenance to prevent application or system issues.

5. Provides and/or arranges for technical support and problem resolution for client inquiries and to resolve production issues.

6. Participates in user training as appropriate, on new or revised systems/applications.

7. Makes modifications to jobs and schedules jobs in production.

8. Stays current on changing methodologies/standard operating procedures. Makes recommendations to management regarding technology investments.

9. Works with the functional specialists to review the business requirements to develop functional design documents.

10. Is a subject matter expert who creates and or modifies methodologies/standard operating procedures, as appropriate.

11. Provides recommendations on vendor selection. Negotiates terms and conditions with vendors.

12. Conducts complete diagnosis of business problems, factoring in a strong understanding of the technical architecture.

13. Develops user training plan for new or revised systems/applications, leveraging vendors and business resources as appropriate to streamline new user or new application adoption.

14. Plays a leadership role in the feasibility analysis for new systems/applications including understanding implications for the current and future architecture to determine how applications and processes can be improved.

This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, or requirements for the job. Management reserves the right to require that other or different tasks be performed as assigned.

1. Ten (10) years of IT experience.

2. Ten (10) years of PeopleSoft System Application (functional and technical) experience. Specifically, ten (10) years’ experience with PeopleSoft Internet Architecture (PIA). Including experience in installing, configuring Application servers (Tuxedo), Process Scheduler servers, Web Servers (Web Logic).

3. Five (5) years of managerial experience.

4. Working knowledge of server hardware, programming languages, and networking devices.

5. Excellent presentation, written, and oral communication skills.

6. Must possess a valid New Jersey driving license.

Job Type: Full-time

title: PS 72 Assistant Director - Afterschool Program
description:
**Overview**

The Assistant Program Director should be a dynamic individual who will have overall responsibility for the work environment. This person must be innovative, creative, and detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills. The Assistant Program Director is responsible, with the Program Director, for ensuring the programmatic quality and integrity of all activities. The Assistant Program Director will be responsible for working as a team member for the benefit of the participants and the program. The Assistant Director will assist the Program Director in managing daily planning, scheduling, and operations at their site. She/he will work with the Program Director to integrate services and assume overall leadership of the DFOY Program in the absence of the Program Director.

**Specific Duties:**

* Assist with recruitment, hiring, training and supervision of staff and volunteers.
* Assist with creating, developing, maintaining and supervising the implementation of program activities.
* Promote program membership/registration.
* Maintain registration, attendance, surveys and questionnaires, and comply with School Age Child Care (SACC), Department of Education (DOE), Department of Health and Department of Youth & Community Development (DYCD) requirements.
* Assist staff with making adjustments and designing activity instructional materials.
* Evaluate and provide recommendations to improve curriculum planning, lesson plans and activity implementation methods across respective grade levels.
* Organize special events and serve as staff liaison with school administration as directed by the Program Director.
* Develop instructional materials for program activities.
* Actively participate in designated meetings, training sessions and special events.
* Be an active leader in developing a positive staff and participant culture.
* Help manage staff schedules and the creation of staff meeting agendas.
* Provide support with the facilitation of parent orientations and meetings.
* Support the Program Director in collaborating with school staff to align program with the school's mission.
* Review student attendance trends and provide needed interventions such as student conversations, parent contact and other progressive methods.
* Support the evaluation of staff needs for professional development and the coordination of staff training and observations in accordance with contractual and Department of Health (DOH) requirements.
* Attend program related meetings in the absence of the Program Director.
* Undertake other program tasks as assigned by supervisor.
* Work with School Staff, School Safety and Cafeteria department to insure all proper permits are submitted for the entire year.

**Daily Tasks:** **Check emails and voicemails: Follow up with parents, subcontractors, stakeholders, Program Director and the Central Office as needed.**

* Check in with the designated staff to ensure all activities are properly staffed and taking place accordingly.
* Ensure supplies are accessible for special events and program activities.
* Work with the Program Director to ensure recruitment outreach is taking place as needed.
* Provide guidance to staff members on daily activities, ensuring all staff members are following the activity curriculum and program schedule.
* Respond to program phone calls in the absence of the Program Director.

**Skills/Qualifications:** **Strong public speaking and writing skills**

* Strong organizational skills
* Experience in curriculum Development
* A team player with demonstrated commitment to working with inner-city youth and young adults
* Experience in word-processing, database computer software programs, and the Internet
* Bi-lingual (Spanish preferred) is a plus, but not required.
* Must have a 4 year degree and/or equivalent work experience with minimum of 2 years direct supervision experience

**Expectations:** The Assistant Director will function in an effective and efficient manner by being proactive in all job functions. The Assistant Director will add to the culture of the organization and specifically work to allow the organization to reach its maximum potential.

The Assistant Director may be needed to participate in meetings with the Program Director and at times may be asked to sit in a meeting for the Program Director. The Assistant Director will perform all duties to the highest quality that matches the trajectory of Directions For Our Youth.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $48,000.00 - $53,000.00 per year

* Paid time off

title: ASSISTANT NURSE MANAGER
description:
**SUMMARY:**

The Assistant Nurse Manager is a registered nurse with accountability for clinical care of a designated patient care service area. Responsible for Assessing, identifying, planning, implementing, and evaluating the processes, technology, personnel, and facility needs required to achieve patient outcomes safely in a patient centered environment. The Assistant Nurse Manager will also assume the role of Nurse Manager in their absence and will assist the Nurse Manager in providing leadership and supervision to the nursing staff.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Implements patient care activities in conjunction with the Nurse Manager and members of the healthcare team
* Assists in the evaluation of quality and effectiveness of nursing care administered to patients, and makes recommendations for improvement to the Nurse Manager
* Monitors selection and use of unit supplies, technology and equipment
* Assures that all unit staff are informed of medical centers developments and participates with the patient care area planning and problem solving
* Conducts /Facilitates leadership and care team meetings, demonstrates ability to achieve meeting outcomes. Maintains records of minutes
* Coordinates ER referrals
* Records, reports and interprets client responses and collaborates with appropriate members of the health team in the Family Practice
* Reads and implements current nursing policies and standards written in nursing literature
* Participates in the department's performance improvement activities
* Assumes responsibilities in the absence of the Nurse Manager, including hiring, termination and evaluation of employees

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* BS in Nursing or equivalent **required**
* Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in clinical setting (ambulatory care setting a plus)
* Minimum of 2 years nursing experience
* Bi-lingual Spanish/English preferred
* Licensed Registered Nurse in New York State
* Current BCLS
* Current Infection Control
* Current Child Abuse Certificate

**Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action:**

The Institute for Family Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. This job summary is intended to be brief and may not list all the duties and functions required, however, it does highlight the essential requirements. Nothing outlined in this job summary is to be construed as an express or implied contract of employment.

**Please visit www.Institute.org for more information.**

title: Customer Service Agent
description:
Customer focused liaison implementing excellence in this Customer Support role. With Miele Business Partners as the customer base, will provide phone and email support to resolve customer issues and manage the sales order through invoice process in an SAP environment to ensure compliance with customer requirements and company protocols. This position is based in our Princeton, NJ office.



Goal: Make it easier to do business with Miele.


**Essential Functions:**


* Provide best in class customer service with a focus on meeting Department KPI’s.


* Collaborate with the Dealer network, National Accounts and all levels of the business including but not limited to Sales, Marketing, Finance, Warehousing and Transportation personnel to meet customer needs while maintaining quality standards.


* Respond to account inquiries by phone and e-mail as part of the dealer support team.


* Enter, monitor, modify, verify, and release standard sales orders through the fulfillment process within an SAP environment.


* Respond to post order customer inquiries by phone and e-mail to resolve disputes, issue debit/credits, and to approve return authorizations.


* Provide requested proof of deliveries or tracking information as requested by external or internal customers.


* Assist with special order intake for assigned account(s). The accounts may be added/removed as needed.


* Other duties, as assigned.


**Qualifications:**


* Minimum of three years of Customer Service in a corporate sales environment preferred.


* One + year experience in an SAP environment preferred.


* Basic Excel skills preferred.


* Two Years of College or Equivalent Work Experience


* Willingness to work overtime, if needed.


* Demonstrated proficiency as a Customer Service Representative from a retailer / distributor / manufacturing environment.


* Excellent verbal / phone, written and chat communications skills.


* Must possess excellent data entry, organizational and investigational skills. Must have above average attention to detail.


* Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills.


**Why you might like working here:**


* You love autonomy and the accountability for results
* You like working for a family run company, market leader in the premium domestic appliance.
* You like working for a company that believes in the aspiration to do it forever better and to be forever better
* A competitive compensation package
* 100% covered Life and long-term disability insurance
* Wellness discounts on medical premiums
* 401k with company match
* Generous Employee Purchase program
* Wellness and volunteer Programs
* Engaging Employee Activities


**ABOUT MIELE**



What does it take for a family run company to become world market leader in the premium domestic appliance and commercial machine segment? It takes more than offering average products, run-of-the-mill service or short-sighted actions. It also requires the aspiration to do it forever better and to be forever better. This stance accounts for a good working environment at Miele and the success of our products.



Our colleagues can rest assured that those who live up to our standards of quality and professionalism grow personally and professionally. No matter if they are at entry levels or managers.



Miele asks a lot of its employees. They are expected to develop and manufacture worldwide market premium products that are "Immer Besser". In return, they receive the most valuable thing Miele can give them: that they themselves become "Immer Besser" - in all of their professional and personal abilities.



"Immer Besser" is therefore an entrepreneurial success principle from which customers and employees benefit in equal measure. We call this principle "MAKE IT BETTER. BE BETTER".



 **Miele is an Equal Opportunity Employer and supports and enforces a drug-free workplace. EOE/AA:M/F/D/V**
company_description: Our philosophy of ‘Immer Besser’ – Forever Better – has helped us to be at the forefront of innovation since 1899.

title: Cleaner
description:
**Hourly Wage**

  

The hourly pay range for this position is $17 per hour - $18 per hour. Benefits are provided in accordance with the location’s Collective Bargaining Agreement.

 **Work Hours**

  

The work hours for this position are Mon-Fri, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm  



  

**Key Purpose**

  

Janitors keep assigned areas, such as offices, commercial spaces, industrial spaces, or institutional buildings, in clean and orderly condition. You will work successfully with fellow employees, clients, and all levels of the organization. You are expected to understand and follow instructions, both verbal and written; and explain how to complete a task using basic communication skills.

 **Success Criteria**

  

* Comply with safety rules, policies, and procedures
* Perform work assignments in a team with other employees
* Maintain clean work area
* Follow all company procedures, policies, and rules
* Take direction and respond to supervision
* Communicate with the lead, supervisor, co-workers, managers, and customers professionally
* Fill in during staff shortage
* Support shift lead in completing punch-list items
* Use proper personal protective equipment
* Present a professional appearance and conduct
* Understand customer service and satisfaction
* Understand reporting systems and the environment
* Instilling trust

 **Key Areas of Collaboration and Influence**

  

* A solid commitment to the guest experience
* Always remember safety first
* Build respectful relationships with all teammates and guests
* Willingness to take directions from the Cleaning Lead, Supervisor, or Manager
* Coordinate activities with other internal departments
* Participate in team meetings

 **Ideal Candidate Experience**

  

* No previous cleaning experience is required
* Understand that safety is a top priority and comply with all safety rules, policies, and procedures
* Must be a team player and committed to working in a quality environment
* Demonstrates exceptional customer service skills

 **Key Accountabilities**

  

* Vacuuming
* Edging
* Dusting
* Cleaning and stocking restrooms and breakrooms
* Window cleaning
* Emptying trash and transporting to proper disposal area
* Sweeping and mopping floors
* May perform other duties as assigned

 **Physical Demands & Work Environment**

  

* To perform the necessary functions and tasks of the job you are required to: Stand 33%, Walk >66%, Sit <10%
* Use of hands and fingers to touch, handle, grip, feel, grasp <66%
* Reach above shoulders <33%
* Push/pull and grasp with hands and arms 33-50%
* Climb or balance <33% Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl <33%
* Perform repetitive tasks
* Must be able to stand for extended periods of time
* Frequently lift 0-10 pounds
* Must be able to work under pressure and time deadlines during peak periods

 *As a global organization, ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and to positively influence the market wherever we operate.*

title: Handyman needed
description:
Mr. Handyman of Westchester County has an immediate opening for a Service Technician in Westchester County, NY. As the Service Technician, you will be responsible for diagnosing, maintaining, repairing, carpentry, and general handyperson tasks for residential and commercial customers. The ideal candidate will have experience in both home repair and commercial maintenance, as well as strong technical skills and a commitment to providing exceptional service to our clients.

**Responsibilities:**

* Maintain an appearance and demeanor representative of the Mr. Handyman image, the Mr. Handyman level of quality, and the Mr. Handyman Way.
* Identify and diagnose issues with equipment and systems, using diagnostic tools and testing equipment as needed to determine the root cause of problems. Repair, replace, or restore faulty components or parts, equipment, and systems to proper working condition.
* Inspect own work in customers’ homes and/or businesses to ensure all work is thoroughly completed, meeting Mr. Handyman quality standards and meeting or exceeding customers’ expectations.
* Manage customer relations, including collection of payments (Credit, Cash, Check, PO, etc.), invoicing, and needed documentation utilizing iPads and provided software systems. Ensure organization and security are kept top of mind at all times.
* Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies while performing maintenance and repair tasks, including wearing appropriate personal protective equipment and following safety protocols. Report all injuries immediately. Injured workers must immediately be seen by a physician/clinic specified by the supervisor.
* Abide by all rules, regulations, and policies contained in the employee handbook, safety manual, and employment agreement, including active participation in identifying, reporting, and correcting situations affecting safety, quality, and customer satisfaction. Attend and participate in all staff meetings.
* Implement preventive maintenance programs to minimize equipment downtime and prevent future issues, including cleaning, lubrication, adjustments, and vehicles. Report all deficiencies or unusual characteristics of the Mr. Handyman vehicle or equipment.

**Qualifications:**

* Punctuality, dependability, neat appearance, professional grooming, thoroughness, consistency with service and solution-oriented perspective
* Empathy and ability to listen, customer service, and interpersonal skills.
* High school diploma or equivalent; technical school or vocational training in a related field preferred.
* 8 years of experience as a service technician in the home repair and/or commercial maintenance industry. Technicians should have their own tools to use.
* Proficiency in using diagnostic tools, testing equipment, and hand/power tools.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English. Bilingual is preferred.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Valid driver's license and clean driving record.
* Ability to stoop, bend, kneel, stretch, lift, and carry in a manner consistent with normal home or commercial repair or maintenance activities.
* Maintain and be available to work the required business hours established for serving customers, without tardiness, interruption, or early departure. Typical business hours are M-F 8am-5pm.
* Ability to read, interpret, and navigate maps throughout the assigned territory area.


Mr. Handyman is committed to providing safe work conditions. The service technician is expected to travel directly to customers’ homes without stopping by the Mr. Handyman office. At times it may be necessary to work overtime to complete a job for a customer. Service technicians usually work alone without direct supervision.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary, opportunities for career advancement, and professional development (starting at $28-$35+/ hr)
* Company-provided van, equipment, and uniform credit.
* Positive and supportive work environment with a focus on safety and teamwork.
* Paid Holidays, Vacation, Bonus Eligibility


If you are a skilled service technician with experience in home repair and commercial maintenance, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our team and be a part of delivering exceptional service to our residential and commercial clients!
company_description: Mr. Handyman is part of the Neighborly® family of independently owned and operated franchisees. Mr. Handyman is your one-call solution for a wide range of home maintenance & repair needs since 1996.

title: Assistant Editor, Metro
description:
The mission of The New York Times is to seek the truth and help people understand the world. That means independent journalism is at the heart of all we do as a company. It’s why we have a world-renowned newsroom that sends journalists to report on the ground from nearly 160 countries. It’s why we focus deeply on how our readers will experience our journalism, from print to audio to a world-class digital and app destination. And it’s why our business strategy centers on making journalism so good that it’s worth paying for.  

Job Description  

The Metro desk of The New York Times is looking for an assistant editor to help shape its daily coverage by overseeing the work of a team of reporters. This editor would play a key role in selecting, assigning and editing breaking news stories, features and mid-range enterprise, as well as overseeing lines of coverage of ongoing stories relevant to their team.
This is an excluded, hybrid position, based in New York City and includes regular attendance in the office each week per your departmental guidance.
Responsibilities:* You will manage a team of reporters.
* You will oversee Live coverage of major breaking news events on their reporters' beats.
* You will collaborate with photo, data, graphics and audio journalists to deliver high-impact digital stories.
* You will generate ideas for news and enterprise, not just for their reporters but for the desk as a whole.
* Demonstrate support and understanding of our value of journalistic independence and a strong commitment to our mission to seek the truth and help people understand the world.
* You will report to the Metro Head Editor.


Basic Qualifications:* 10+ years’ experience at a journalism or media company or other relevant organization
* Editing skills that demonstrate mastery of journalistic style and standards, including ethical and superb news judgment
* Experience managing reporters
* Digital skills that show a willingness to experiment and try new ways to connect with readers
* Demonstrated metabolism to run breaking news coverage and the focus to deliver slow-developing enterprise.


Preferred Qualifications:* Experience promoting a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* An openness to trying new story-telling approaches


The annual base pay salary for this role is between $150,000.00 and $176,000.00.
The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.
The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The New York Times Company will provide reasonable accommodations as required by applicable federal, state, and/or local laws. Individuals seeking an accommodation for the application or interview process should email reasonable.accommodations@nytimes.com. Emails sent for unrelated issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.
The Company will further consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable "Fair Chance" laws.
The New York Times Company follows the pay transparency and non-discrimination provisions outlined by the United States Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs. Click here for details.
company_description: The New York Times is dedicated to helping people understand the world through on-the-ground, expert and deeply reported independent journalism.

title: Trade Reporting Associate
description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

  

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

  

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $83,000.00 and $125,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

**Role Description**
--------------------


SMBC Capital Markets, Inc. (CM) is a derivatives trading company which was started in 1988 and is based in New York City, with offices in London and Hong Kong. SMBC CM is an established derivatives dealer with a broad product portfolio, with specific emphasis on interest rates and foreign exchange products such as interest & FX swaps, FRAs, options, exotic products, commodity derivatives as well as exchange traded products such as treasury bonds, interest rate futures & options, currency futures, treasury futures & options, etc.

  

The Regulatory Trade Reporting team is looking to hire an associate to be responsible for the maintenance of Alteryx generated reports and general data management within Trade Reporting Operations.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  



* Analyze new data sources and build mapping tables to integrate them into existing framework
* Assist with the design of new workflows within Alteryx
* Help develop and maintain reporting solutions via Alteryx, Tableau and PowerBI for day to day operational support and to provide regular updates to Senior Management.
* Support business reporting by guiding, designing, developing new reports.
* Aid in creation Ad-Hoc reports when necessary for compliance and senior management.
* Help develop and support the team’s growing data infrastructure from an operations perspective
**Qualifications and Skills**
-----------------------------

* 2-5 years of experience with report building and data administration.
* Attention to detail
* Self-starter that is able to work independently
* Able to design, create and manage databases that integrate various sources for MIS reporting
* Work with large datasets
**Additional Requirements**
---------------------------


SMBC’s employees participate in a hybrid workforce model that provides employees with an opportunity to work from home, as well as, from an SMBC office. SMBC requires that employees live within a reasonable commuting distance of their office location. Prospective candidates will learn more about their specific hybrid work schedule during their interview process.

  

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. SMBC provides reasonable accommodations for employees and applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.

title: Vice President, Corporate Banking Portfolio Management
description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

  

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

  

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $126,000.00 and $180,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

**Overview**
------------


We are hiring an experienced candidate to join the Portfolio Management Group (PMG) within the Americas Division (AD). Among its various responsibilities, a key role of PMG is to analyze the profitability of clients, businesses, and sectors to provide findings that inform the strategic direction of the bank. This role will be responsible for key pillars of the PMG function including data sourcing to build out client and bank level peer comparisons, managing portfolio reporting and budgeting topics with Finance, and leading efforts with IT to improve systems and data quality. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of using advanced technical tools to create efficient processes that support a deep understanding of data and have the capacity to clearly explain findings to senior management. In addition, they will be able to independently manage complex projects with minimal supervision.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop wholistic strategy for PMG analytical tools, dashboards, and technology development. Chart course for team’s future technology plan and manage our team’s relationship with IT.
* Independently carry out complex projects, such as scenario analysis development or project management for system improvement, with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate will need to be able to take vague ideas or problems and turn them in to actionable projects.
* Source relevant information and manage vendor relationships to procure external data for profitability benchmarking.
* Lead PMG’s partnership with the broader finance and treasury organizations to ensure alignment on profitability and forecasting efforts. Proactively update PMG’s profitability framework to support changes.
* Automate essential data aggregation functionality to enhance analytical capabilities using Python, SQL, and Tableau.
* Present profitability results to senior management to enhance understanding of specific clients\\sectors and support strategic decision making. Explain complex profitability topics or methodology changes convincingly to a non-technical audience.
* Develop consensus with marketing departments regarding aggregation of client data and foster ongoing working relationships.
**Qualifications**
------------------


Minimum Qualifications:

* 5-7 years of work experience in data and analytics
* Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to create informative and accurate reporting
* Advanced Excel and Power Point skills

  

Preferred Qualifications:

* 5-7 years of work experience in data and analytics in corporate banking
* Independent management of projects partnering with multiple departments and ability to influence senior level stakeholders
* Experience working with finance on budgeting topics
* Track record of driving creative technical solutions with IT to solve business problems
* At least 3 years of experience using Python, Tableau, and SQL
* Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III) and capital allocation models
**Additional Requirements**
---------------------------


D&I Commitment


Responsible for fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion, holding leaders accountable for creating an inclusive environment through awareness and practice of equity in recruiting, developing, and promoting diverse talent.


SMBC’s employees participate in a hybrid workforce model that provides employees with an opportunity to work from home, as well as, from an SMBC office. SMBC requires that employees live within a reasonable commuting distance of their office location. Prospective candidates will learn more about their specific hybrid work schedule during their interview process.

  

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. SMBC provides reasonable accommodations for employees and applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.

description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc.
